developerResponse: {'id': 2071864, 'body': "Hi Missy Belle, BPme has been developed to make your life a little bit easier, but we still  want to ensure your personal details are safe and correct, which is why there are a few steps to registering for BPme, inclusive of the SMS phone verification code as well as email confirmation link when setting up the app. As BPme requires a payment method to be loaded into the app, we want to ensure the security of this information is highly protected. title: Rip OFF

review:
The biggest downside compared to competitors apps is the lack of a live price board. Until that arrives I I’ll be uninstalling.
It could also do with some basic finishing touches.
This is what I experienced from the sign up process.
When entering my name it wasn’t automatically capitalised.
When creating a password if you use Safari’s Suggest Password option you cannot auto fill that password when trying to log in to the app.
The workaround is to go into iPhone settings and get it out of there. But when you switch back to the BP app it wipes your email address so you have to type it in again.
Then after pasting the password the login button doesn’t allow you to click it.
The workaround for that is to backspace and type the last character of the password. But again when switching between the app and settings the page is wiped and you need to start over.
How frustrating!
developerResponse: {'id': 2105236, 'body': "Hi chipper, BPme doesn't list fuel prices, the price you'll pay per litre is shown on the price board at the front of the servo as well as on the bowser. At this stage we have no plans to integrate fuel pricing into the app. With regards to your other issues, we will pass these on to the developers.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T04:23:58Z'}
title: No live prices, no thanks.

review:
After using the app for the first time, I can safely say that I won’t be using it again. 

After sitting in my car, waiting for the app to find my location and then selecting the pump number, it took about another minute before the pump was actually unlocked and the app to tell to commence filling up my car. 

Once I had finished refuelling, I return the fuel hose and jumped into my car. Here the screen was still stuck on a loading screen. Waiting for the next screen to pop up confirming that the transaction had been paid for. 

This screen took another couple minutes just sitting there. So I sat in my car again. Not wanting to drive away not paying for fuel. 

Frustrated, I went into the shop and told the attendant my issue, that I’m not sure if I’ve paid yet and that if he can confirm. 

The response I was greeted with was deplorable. Absolutely rude. “You’re using the app. I don’t know why you came in for. You’re wasting your time and my time now. Just go” 

Angrily, I just left immediately. Disgusted. 

Only till I drove down the road away from the fuel station, the screen changed and showed a payment confirmation screen. 

There needs to be some confidence in this system, as I don’t want to have the police called to my house down the track for doing a runner. 

Endless amounts of time are just spent waiting in the car, instead of just going into the shop. 

People behind me in the queue waiting to fill up are getting angry, that I’m just sitting here doing nothing in my car.

Time of incident:

18/12/17, 08:27:17
developerResponse: {'id': 2065274, 'body': 'Hi Andy, this is not the customer experience or service we strive for at BP. Can you please confirm the location and approximate time, so we can look into this as a priority. Thank you.', 'modified': '2017-12-18T11:16:52Z'}
title: Worst experience ever

No ability to earn velocity points through the App. Thanks for wasting my time and money.

title: It didn’t work

review:
Absolute garbage app.

Two tries both terrible experience.  Need to fiddle around with setting up BEFORE even starting to fill.  Not good when there are a dozen cars waiting behind you.  (Im not talking about the one time registration which goes without saying needs to be completed, I’m talking about the need to connect to the station, choose a pump and wait for the start filling prompt before you can get started and this all happens slow) Then when done the app doesn’t switch from the fill now prompt, to payment processing.  Have to go inside and have them manually acknowledge the purchase before it will continue.  Also no Velocity points using the app.

Even if it was capable of processing a purchase without needing to go inside, it is not a time saver by the time you go through pre-fill setup, fill and then process payment.  Driving in and needing to setup a pump connection and wait for the you can now fill, then when done going back to the app a second time and spending the same time again to process the payment doesn’t cut it.

The expectation, especially if it is going to save any time, is you drive in fill up then open the app choose the pump and process the outstanding balance.

As mentioned, in my experience, every visit has also required going in, getting in the queue and having them fiddle around on the computer to get the payment to start processing in the app.

Regarding registration, BPme has been developed to make your life a little bit easier, but we still  want to ensure your personal details are safe and correct, which is why there are a few steps to registering for BPme. Make sure you have the app downloaded to your smartphone and your payment details added to make refuelling faster on the go. You can also continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Please watch this space for new BPme features in the future. Thanks.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T11:39:20Z'}

Great work BP.

title: Velocity?

review: Fuel is expensive enough so they add an extra dollar to use the App. What’s worse is we’re being sold out by our government letting these crooks do this. I’d give it a zero but they want you to put a minimum of 1 which isn’t worthy of it.
developerResponse: {'id': 2229507, 'body': 'Hi FEE, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid. This will be released by your financial provider. The time it takes will vary depending on the card issuer or bank. We suggest you contact your bank directly if you have further questions.', 'modified': '2018-01-08T01:07:36Z'}
title: FEE

review:
....a bit cut and pasted. Telling customers with legit grievances that great things are planned for the future of this app and to “Watch this space”  when they are spilling out how the app’s non-performance or underfunction is eating their cash and time is absurd.

It sounds like something Donald Trump would say, and that isn’t good.

Obviously, if the baseline purpose of the launch was ONLY to provide folks the ability to locate a station and pay easily, without headaches, but not to provide for Velocity points (which for some folks is their first and best reason to use BP) then the app still is a fail because folks aren’t able to fulfill the first criteria. 

You should repeal the app, bring it up to speed properly, then re-release it. Folks don’t like being jerked around just for BP marketing purposes.
developerResponse: {'id': 2231899, 'body': "Hi there,\nThanks for your detailed review. We're aware that a small number of customers have had technical difficulties with the app and we’re working on resolving these issues as quickly as possible. While we know that many customers love earning Velocity Frequent Flyer points at BP, for the launch we had always planned on only introducing the fuel payment function which will help customers save time. We intend to introduce new features over time, as you’ve noted. \nCheers", 'modified': '2018-01-08T05:50:44Z'}

review: Won’t accept my BP CARD. Pointless

title: Don’t waste your time

review: Great app & worked perfectly (although I felt like a thief not going in to the store to pay) ... NOT linked to velocity yet so will continue to go in to the store for now.  Will be AWESOME when linked.
developerResponse: {'id': 2235989, 'body': "Hi hel65, thank you for the feedback, we're so happy to hear that! We expect paying for your fuel using BPme to quickly become a ‘new norm’ at our sites. We will have plenty of signage at our sites about the new app and of course our staff know all about BPme. Customers can still give a little wave or thumbs up to staff if they’d like. Thank you also for your comment about Velocity, when new functionality is available we will communicate with BPme users via the app and also our website and social media. Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-01-08T10:39:24Z'}
title: Nearly awesome !!

review:
Everything is too slow, even the 4 did it pin produces a waiting “wheel”. Should be instant.
When you pay from your phone all it does is it passes transaction to the kiosk and it then has to be processed manually by the staff, who advised me that it takes a while.
If non app customers are queued in kiosk while staff are “processing” App payments from people sat in cars it won’t be a good look.
Appears that whole thing hasn’t been well thought thru.
Hope it improves as good potential.
developerResponse: {'id': 2244586, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback about what you experienced- it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. If you could please provide more information such as the specific station, time and date of the transaction I will be able to pass it onto the relevant team to investigate further. Cheers', 'modified': '2018-01-09T04:30:11Z'}
title: Needs lot of work

review: This app I really liked until it charged me twice for fuel. Have been trying to get in touch with them to have it fixed, I was yesterday on hold half an hour and then put through to an after hours service who put through an ASAP message to call me back. Never heard back. Now on hold again next day for 14 minutes and counting.
developerResponse: {'id': 2278466, 'body': "Hi Jme girl, we've been made aware that your issue has been resolved. We apologies for your experience and hope to see you use our app in the future. Kind regards", 'modified': '2018-01-12T05:14:18Z'}
title: Charged twice

review: A little bit slow, but loved that I didn’t have to leave the car and disturb my sleeping bub. Looking forward to it being available at more stations in Vic.
developerResponse: {'id': 2278381, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for the feedback, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits.", 'modified': '2018-01-12T04:37:24Z'}
title: Slow but very handy!

review:
A little tricky to setup for me, mainly because I assumed I could create a single account for the family (not so).  Then I accidentally entered the wrong PayPal account which I tried to change but couldn’t, but then figured out later I could delete it and then newly enter the correct account (sigh).

At first use at the fuel station I was pleasantly surprised it was very easy and quick to use. Finger print login super easy. Pump selection could be easier, sorry but using Apple’s list scroller is not the best way to pick a simple pump number (lost a Star). Everything else worked amazingly smoothly and quickly. I love the fact that the map shows which stations do and do not support BPme.   This app hands down beats the USA method of using credit cards at the pump. Fantastic job BP, thank you for making my life easier with young ones in the back seat.
developerResponse: {'id': 2290755, 'body': "Hi DopeyBear681, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits. Thanks also your feedback, please feel free to email your suggestions for improving the app to aucustcare@bp.com and we will pass them on to the developers. Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-01-13T23:42:08Z'}
title: Just works, thank you BP

review: Really disappointed that the app doesn't support earning velocity points, and that the mornington peninsula is so poorly represented on the map. Won't be using app unless it's linked with velocity points, so hopefully that will be in the near future.
developerResponse: {'id': 2294277, 'body': "Hi there, the app is available at over 600 (and rising) BP stations across the country, and likely to build to 700+ stations within the year. To check your nearest BPme enabled station, open the Station Finder and apply the 'BPme enabled' filter. With regards to your second issue, you can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP.", 'modified': '2018-01-14T22:53:57Z'}
title: Disappointed

review: Pulled up at my local BP to find the app doesn’t work at that location

To check your nearest BPme enabled station, open the Station Finder and apply the 'BPme enabled' filter. Cheers", 'modified': '2018-01-14T22:46:55Z'}
title: Limited use

review:
Just used the app for the first time, registration was a breeze when using PayPal to set up. Kinda sucked that I needed to sign into PayPal twice (once on sign up and again on selecting payment method). Other than that it was a breeze.

Its really scary using this app because it feels like I just stole petrol lol (I had to check my receipt several times to make sure I paid for my petrol before leaving).

I love the concept of this app, wish it had velocity points though! But, to the future!!
developerResponse: {'id': 2303397, 'body': 'Hi Joshua, we are glad to hear that and thanks very much for your feedback. We expect paying for your fuel using BPme to quickly become a ‘new norm’ at our sites. The app technology enables us to link the petrol bowser to the mobile wallet the app; so yes it is a bit like magic. The app also notifies the site staff that payment has been made. We will have plenty of signage at our sites about the new app and of course our staff know all about BPme. Customers can still give a little wave or thumbs up to staff if they’d like. With Velocity, we are committed to evolving and improving our unique new offer over time. New features and functionality for BPme will be made available in the future. Cheers.', 'modified': '2018-01-15T12:11:00Z'}
title: Scary! But cool!

review:
I won’t use the app until it supports Velocity points.
Please don’t reply by telling me I can use my Velocity card inside the store. I know that. It’s obvious 
Just incorporate it into this app and I will start using it.
developerResponse: {'id': 2308512, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback which we have fed back to our developer team. We’re continuously working with our developers to ensure the user experience is optimum and we’re exploring new innovations to bring to market early this year.', 'modified': '2018-01-15T23:04:03Z'}
title: Doesn’t support Velocity Points

review: Setting up my account and adding a payment option was easy and relatively fast. Used the app at the bowser yesterday and all went smoothly and quickly.  The “pay for fuel” tab was self explanatory and easy to navigate. Currently no option to link Velocity points (lost a rating star for that). I understand velocity cards can still be used in-store but this defeats the purpose of the app in my opinion. From reading other previous reviews of this app it is quite clear that many consumers (myself included) believe this feature should have been included in the initial release, not been left as an afterthought with a promise that “the app is under constant development and more features will be added in the future”. It currently feels like we are “missing out” on a reward we would have otherwise be offered. All round a great app and keen to see the rewards link option soon.
developerResponse: {'id': 2331425, 'body': 'Hi there, we appreciate your praise with regards to the core functionality of the app and fully understand your stance regarding Velocity integration, we understand that the inability to claim Velocity Points via the app is a drawback for many of our customers. As you’ve pointed out, though, we are working on bringing new features to the app which will hopefully bring with them a better customer experience. Once again, we appreciate the time you’ve taken to rate our app.', 'modified': '2018-01-18T02:41:09Z'}

review: Was so excited by this app. Was easy to set up. But been to a number of different BPs now, including a very new station and every single one doesn’t have the facilities to use the app... what a waste of my time! Way to get people into BP! Offer a product that doesn’t actually exist.

title: Do any BPs actually have the facilities to use the app?!

review:
Excellent creativity on BPs behalf creating an app such as this. I have been waiting for fuel stations to design an app to streamline what can be a painful process in filling up, especially when you’ve forgotten, the tank is low, and you need to be somewhere in a hurry.
Unfortunately the app is far too slow and not at enough BP stations as of yet, and it is almost just as easy to pay in store. Sitting in the car watching the screen load is frustrating when I could be out there putting fuel in my car. I am using an iPhone X so the phone shouldn’t be the issue.
Also the lack of velocity support is weird as that has been a big advertising push by BP over the past year or so.
Hopefully I have just had a couple of average experiences so far and will continue to use and re review when and if they add velocity support
developerResponse: {'id': 2353503, 'body': "Hi Melant, thanks for your interest in BPme and we're sorry to hear about your experience. We are looking into this further to understand what caused this. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience and we will pass this on to the developers. For the initial BPme launch, we have introduced the fuel payment function to help customers save time. BPme is transformational and we are planning a whole range of exciting new offers to make our customers lives easier. You can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Watch this space for new features in the future. BPme is now available at over 600 BP stations across the country, and is likely to grow to over 700 stations in the new year. You can check your nearest nearest BP participating station in the Station Finder in the app. Thanks.", 'modified': '2018-01-20T22:37:28Z'}
title: Great idea, poor execution

review:
Downloaded the app and discovered there was no option to link your Velocity card to claim points. Considering you plugged the hell out of this association with Virgin at all your stations and advertising wise, it’s ridiculous you couldn’t hire some devs worth their weight to integrate it before rolling out the app. 
So you get one star because I assume the app does what it’s meant to. I didn’t bother trying once I saw the lack of a Velocity feature. You get a second star for being easy to navigate and understand. You would have got 4 if this linked Velocity feature was in. 
For now, I’ll walk in and take 2 extra minutes out of my day to walk in store and pay and claim my points. I’ll probably never check for an update as I’m now deleting it. So much for technology lol
developerResponse: {'id': 2353516, 'body': 'Hi luketurton, thanks for your feedback and we hope that you receive this response. For the initial BPme launch, we have introduced the fuel payment function to help customers save time. BPme is transformational and we are planning a whole range of exciting new offers to make our customers lives easier. You can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. When new functionality is available we will communicate with BPme users via the app and also our website and social media. Thanks.', 'modified': '2018-01-20T22:45:03Z'}
title: Uhhhhh Velocity?

review:
Managed to complete registration in around 5 minutes at home on wifi. Wasn’t slow as others have written. The only problem I encountered was that once at the station it only listed around half of the pumps and then one I was at (8) wasn’t listed. Went inside to pay, attendant said it’s been happening and they’re hoping it will be fixed soon so that all pumps are detected.
Update - have since encountered “incorrect pin” problem when logging in. Despite my resetting pin it keeps saying pin is incorrect.
developerResponse: {'id': 2401495, 'body': "Hi Lucie, thanks for letting us know that the app works for you now. With regards to pump 8 not being listed, it could be that the pump could have AdBlue as an option. There are regulations selling AdBlue that prevents us from offering it on BPme just yet. We will keep you updated if anything changes. If that's not the case, could you tell us which store you were at so we can ring the store and help them out. Cheers. Response to update - We're sorry to hear you had this experience. If you send a note to aucustcare@bp.com with details about what’s not working, we’ll help get it sorted.", 'modified': '2018-01-25T11:06:26Z'}

review: Pointless without

Watch this space for new BPme features in the future.\nCheers', 'modified': '2018-01-22T02:57:45Z'}
title: Needs velocity

review: It’s good we can pay using the app but what about about velocity points? App should be able to link to velocity as well so we can still get points.

We intend to introduce new features to the app in the future. Customers can continue to use their Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP until further notice.', 'modified': '2018-01-24T00:49:04Z'}
title: Velocity points

review: Great concept but needs work, firstly it’s very slow to “unlock the pump”. I also had an issue with the app not switching from the “pump now” screen to the payment confirmation. I closed the app in the multitasking menu which seemed to make this happen, the only reason I knew payment went though was because my credit card sent me a push notification of a recent payment to BP. Maybe you should consider enabling a push notification as an indicator that it has gone through and you’re fine to force off? It all felt too slow and clunky, would have spent the same time walking into store and laying at one of the self serve kiosks. Also find it very ridiculous that the app doesn’t support velocity, and a reason I won’t be using the app moving forward considering I am only loyal to BP for Velocity Points...
developerResponse: {'id': 2394530, 'body': 'Hi Dennis, many thanks for your feedback and suggested improvement to the app, we have forwarded your push notification idea to our developers. With regards to Velocity and app optimisations, the app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience. Thank you for remaining loyal during this time.', 'modified': '2018-01-24T22:44:29Z'}
title: Dennis

review: Thanks BP for developing this app. This allows me to fuel and pay from car and not wait in long queues during peak hours.. that’s just so cool. The app works well for everything except a slight delay in the payment processing. Please improve on that and I will give 5 star 😀
developerResponse: {'id': 2398817, 'body': "Hi Prashanthradhakrishnan, thank you for the feedback, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits. Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-01-25T07:41:02Z'}
title: Bpme - Fuelling easy as a breeze now

review:
Honestly just a paywave box at each terminal would have been 100%

Spent so much on advertising for this app when the money could have been gone to making it actually work.

No velocity, some buttons don’t work, no keychain integration, time consuming at the pump would cause congestion.

Honestly just being able to open app choose pump and fingerprint Apple Pay bang done. Or just paywave/pass terminal so you can tap and go would be much better... was the most frustrating thing getting this setup so hence the review
developerResponse: {'id': 2424377, 'body': 'Hi benny, thank you for your feedback which we have fed back to our developer team. We’re continuously working with our developers to ensure the user experience is optimum and we’re exploring new innovations to bring to market this year. With regards to your last suggestion, there are more artifacts to take into consideration with implementing paywave/paypass functionality to our pumps.', 'modified': '2018-01-28T22:43:47Z'}
title: Takes longer than waking inside

review: Set up while tedious worked. When I first trialed the app it had difficulty finding a station. No such troubles now. Works as expected. Quick and efficient. I’ll give it five stars when you can link your velocity card to your account.

Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-01-27T23:14:48Z'}
title: Works as expected

review:
I wish I could give this 0 stars.

After going through the lengthy sign up process I thought I was all set. I went out of my way to find a BP to use the app as I had a newborn and 18 month old, I check the app is connecting to the station, fill her up and then go to checkout...wait wait wait nothing happens but the lady at the register obviously could tell I was trying to do it and runs out to tell me the app isn't working there. Well that would have been nice to know BEFORE I started filling my car up. So now I have to get both sleeping children out of the car and put them in a pram so I can go and pay. I definitely wouldn't have even bothered going to a BP if it wasn't for the promise of this app, as let's be honest, they are always 5-10c dearer than every where else.

If you’d like more info on petrol pricing in Australia please go to http://www.aip.com.au/facts-about-prices.', 'modified': '2018-01-28T22:36:25Z'}

title: What about Velocity points?

review:
Does what it says on the tin but disappointing none the less. Email receipts are handy but assumed that Velocity would be included as a baseline feature, sadly I was disappointed - should have read the reviews first.

The most recent patch added nothing but the option to volunteer for extra marketing emails. If I was the developer responsible I'd be ashamed of myself.

Would recommend anybody who deletes the app, also email the customer care centre to have your account closed so your credit card details aren't in the wild once the inevitable security breach occurs.

title: Velocity link

review:
I went to use the app for the first time today after setting up the app about a week ago.
Logged in with my PIN once I got to the servo, told it what pump I was at and it said I was good to go!
Put fuel in my car and drove away! Then the app said “there was an issue, keep driving and we will contact you later”
Ahhhhh did I just drive away without paying?? Got a txt about 10 minutes later asking to tap the link and to pay for the fuel. Which I did (with the same card that didn’t work in the app). Thought I would go in and check the card details which I couldn’t do so I just deleted the card details and went to re-enter them. Now the app doesn’t want to take my card details. 

What a waste of time!
developerResponse: {'id': 2526227, 'body': 'Hi Craig, what you did in that instance is correct, if the connection to the payment service drops it will attempt to reconnect whilst you are on your way and the text that you received will be sent if the app cannot reconnect to take payment. With regards to you not being able to re-add your card details, we are looking into this further to understand what caused it.', 'modified': '2018-02-07T22:22:20Z'}
title: Looks great but doesn’t work!

review: I love the idea of this app and have used it a few times but the app is very slow and it’s actually quicker to go inside & pay.

Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience and we will pass this on to the developers. Cheers.', 'modified': '2018-02-07T11:43:46Z'}
title: Good core functionality but very slow

userName: dub head aotearoa kai te pai
review:
Thought I’d check it out.

Yes easy to use, but when checked my statement, $1 for POS was also charged.

Now there will be a small print to say this, but throughout the sign up process this was not easily noticed. So sneaky sneaky BP!

So effectively, Petrol will be more expensive using this app.

Will now shop elsewhere due to this experience.
developerResponse: {'id': 2539702, 'body': 'Hi dub head aotearoa kai te pai, thanks for your review. Cheers.', 'modified': '2018-02-09T07:18:18Z'}
title: Hidden charges

review: Have used it several times now without an issue. By the time I put on the fuel cap and get back in the car it has already processed the payment. No more waiting in store for people buying coffee etc. and especially good when getting fuel after hours.
developerResponse: {'id': 2546299, 'body': "Hi Lickaburn, thank you for the feedback, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits. Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-02-09T23:48:21Z'}
title: Works well, love the convenience and not having to wait

review: My first time using the app on way to work to save time. Unlocked the pump quick. Filled up car, sat waiting for confirmation, eventually a pop up told me delay in sending email receipt and I could leave station.  Thought I better go in and check. Guy was frantically going between two terminals and told me he couldn’t get it to go through.  Eventually paid on card after he assured me I wouldn’t be charged twice.  Was late for work as it took twice as long as normal.  Was soo hoping this app would be a good timesaver but I’m apprehensive to try it again.  It really needs to be a cloud system rather than needing an operator in store to manually process it, defeats the purpose imo.
developerResponse: {'id': 2554804, 'body': "Hi Cosmic, sorry for the inconvenience. It sounds as though this particular BP is independently owned and operated. developerResponse: {'id': 2697197, 'body': 'Hi Shez, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure). This will be released by your financial provider. Your financial provider will be able to give you more information on how long it will take to be released, but generally for financial cards like VISA, AMEX and MasterCard, the pre authorisation hold will be released from the account within 3-10 days. With all PayPal transactions, your account will show the $1 pre authorisation hold for 29 days and will feature as a pending payment in your account.\n\nWe suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions.', 'modified': '2018-02-27T22:37:07Z'}

title: Great idea!

review:
Second time I use BPme. 
Pulled up at pump. Opened the app. 
Wife: ‘How is this faster?’
Waiting for app to load. 
It asks me to log in. 
Wife: ‘How is this faster?’
Type in username. 
Type in password.
Wife: ‘How is this faster?’
Loading. 
Mother’s maiden name?
Wife: ‘How is this faster?’
Me: ‘It’s not!!’
Got out, filled, paid attendant.

title: Velocity

review: The initial setup process is too long and switches between the app & online. I also made the mistake the first time of filling up before launching the app and then had to wait for the store person to override it before it would process my payment. Made it half way to the register before that happened. There should be an option come up to select whether you have filled up already or not. Used it today for the second time and remembered to open the app first but even though the app says the pump is released and able to be used you still have to wait until the store person releases it before you can fill up. Also massive lag between finishing and the payment being approved. I actually got my emailed receipt before the app showed that payment had been made & I could drive off. It is good to not have to get all of the kids out of the car to pay for fuel but with all the lags it doesn’t actually save much time. Disappointing also that not all places accept the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2785156, 'body': 'Hi Gio12344321, thank you for your detailed feedback and suggestions. Regarding the unlocking of the pump, thank you for letting us know- it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. If you could please provide more information such as the specific station, time and date of the transaction I will be able to pass it onto the relevant team to investigate further. Regarding approval of payment, thanks for your feedback, we are looking into this further to understand what caused this. The app is available at over 600 (and rising) BP stations across the country, and likely to build to 700+ stations in 2018. To check your nearest BPme enabled station, simply download the app and find the nearest BP participating station in the Station Finder. Thanks.', 'modified': '2018-03-09T10:16:50Z'}

The process to unlock a pump is taking too much time, the cashier has to manually unlock the pump at his computer and when there’s a queue or the computer is not working (happened the third time I was using this app), it would just take more time than going inside.

A terminal at the pump for credit card and mobile payment would’ve been quicker.

title: No Virgin points inclusion

review:
There should be a way for the user indicate that you have stopped pumping. Sometimes have to wait an eternity for an update. 

Says uses wallet but for what? 

Can’t pull from saved passwords, doesn’t support using Apple Pay. Too hard to setup. 

Also, I should be able pick a value before starting to pump. Then I don’t need to worry about anything. Pre authorise the amount before pumping and confirm post pump. You can always refund if you don’t hit that value.

Can’t add my velocity so every time I use this app I loose points.

The phone is constantly receiving signal with or without an app running so it is ridiculous to think the app has any chance of causing a spark whilst at the bowser.  You need to change the rules to allow bike riders the ability to use this app ASAP

review: Installed the app about a week ago and haven’t used it yet. Had an initial problem with a “unauthorised transaction” but that has been satisfactorily resolved (it was my bank that did this). So I have updated my initial review.
developerResponse: {'id': 2809895, 'body': 'Hi there, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure). This will be released by your financial provider. Your financial provider will be able to give you more information on how long it will take to be released, but generally for financial cards like VISA, AMEX and MasterCard, the pre authorisation hold will be released from the account within 3-10 days. With all PayPal transactions, your account will show the $1 pre authorisation hold for 29 days and will feature as a pending payment in your account.\n\nWe suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions.', 'modified': '2018-03-13T03:35:54Z'}
title: Great idea

review: Love the idea of the app and streamlining the whole process of filling up however for me this app defeats the purpose, what about corporate or business people with business fleet cards who are always on the go this app would be perfect if it used a fleet card feature to fill up petrol.

title: Too complicated and too slow

review:
Fantastic idea, brilliant when it works.

Few teething problems which can probably be ironed out. 
Sometimes hangs on “your pump is now unlocked” even though you have finished filling up.
Other times hangs on processing payment. Not sure if this is a time of use or connectivity issue on my end perhaps. Twice I’ve had the message that something’s gone wrong, by all means leave the station and we’ll continue trying to process payment.

I used to have a PIN set up for easy access. After an update apparently I now need to log in with my full credentials and security question every time I want to use it. 

Would love to see Velocity added to the app. Not sure why it can’t be. I use this as a mother with a baby, it is a godsend to not have to get her out of the car for fuel but then I am missing out on points. 

Overall though it’s a reasonable app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2969863, 'body': "Hi L, thank you for your feedback. We're glad to hear that BPme is making parenting life easier. My apologies for the issues you are experiencing. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. So we can best assist and get this sorted for you could you please drop a note to aucustcare@bp.com with your user details and about what’s not working? Thank you. Also, new features and functionality within BPme will be available in the future. When new functionality is available we will be sure to let you know via the app and also on our website and across our social profiles. Cheers, Tanya", 'modified': '2018-03-29T10:45:00Z'}
title: Almost there

review:
Apps is really slow and unresponsive which means it takes your time. But the saddest part is they charged me extra for fuelling up when the card was decline (not my fault but they guy behind the counter pressed 95 instead of 98).
So i was fuelling up at bp summer hill, so i started the apps and wait for the apps to load (which is slow) and followed their instruction by choosing the station and pump number. I then proceed to fill up my car and wait till it approve. However, it got declined. So i went in and ask the gentleman behind the counter. He claimed that i paid which i went to my banking apps and my account still hasnt been deducted in full. However they deduct $1 off me (till this day i dont know whats that for. And no this is not the first time im using it). So the person behind the counter was confused and he called his manager and they were talking in their language which i couldnt understand and he hung up and told me to just drive and BP will contact me so i being paranoid i told him to take my mobile number just incase. He admitted that he pressed a wrong fuel type prior of me fuelling up. I left and couple hours later, i received a message from BP to pay my account via a link but when i checked they charge me another $3 for a mistake that i didnt even do. I dont think this is right i mean $4 dollar to use an app that supposedly make your life easier. Sorry if i sound like a cheapskate but i just fuelled up for 20 dollar so it doesnt really make sense. I hope BP review their apps and train their managers to actually get the information across to their staffs.
developerResponse: {'id': 3008328, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback about what you experienced, it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. Your feedback has also been forwarded to our Area Manager specific to that station for further investigation and to undertake any appropriate action. With regards to being charged extra for the CSR's mistake, please contact us on 1300 1300 27; following the prompts for BPme so we can assist further.", 'modified': '2018-04-03T02:10:44Z'}
title: Slow and they charged you extra

review:
I have used the app and see the potential being very smart. 
Unfortunately I won’t use it again because it still doesn’t incorporate the Velocity Rewards points. I have spoken with BP Customer Service and they inform me of receiving many complaints about the same thing. 
BP now have an App that lets us do more while they benefit from doing less. If anything we should get bonus points for using the App. 
I see a response from 18 Jan but no action yet. 
If BP wants to make this project a success then get things moving by incorporating Rewards.

review: I think I’ll wait until all the nightmares described in the feedback have been dealt with. As many before me have already said, this app is of no use without Velocity integration and I’d also love to see multiple velocity account functionality as part of that.

title: Useless without Velocity

review: Seriously, where are the interface instructions? Not obvious that you need to double confirm credit card details before it primes the pump (and confirm button is under the fold) so frustrating. Should save time but does not. So very slow.
developerResponse: {'id': 3319750, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback which we have fed back to our developer team.', 'modified': '2018-05-02T00:47:54Z'}
title: Rubbish and slow

review: No velocity. Need I say more. Arrived at station, opened app selected bowser had to wait for operator to unlock (Pointless) finished refueling returned nozzle, and drive off. Yet the screen was stuck in the fuel delivery in progress screen. Almost 30 later is when I got my email receipt or any notice that the payment went through. Stressing out the entire time in case the cops turn up to my house for stealing fuel. Not a pleasant experience. App deleted.
developerResponse: {'id': 3319752, 'body': 'Hi Olly, thank you for your feedback which we have fed back to our developer team.', 'modified': '2018-05-02T00:48:21Z'}
title: Pointless

review: I’ve used the app three times now, and of those times it’s only worked once. The only time it did work I had to go into the service station because the attendant didn’t do whatever he was supposed to on his end. The other two times the app was temporarily unavailable. So 3 out of 3 times I’ve had to get a sleeping newborn out of the car. I drive out of my way to get to the station, only for the app not to work. More of an inconvenience. Station was Whitebridge, NSW
developerResponse: {'id': 3301783, 'body': 'Hi Leah, thank you for your feedback about what you experienced, it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. title: Unreliable

review: BP has a promotion with Amex but Amex is the only credit card that can not be added onto the app. waste of time

title: Waste of time

review:
Takes too long to register switching between app, email, browser & back to app. Did not even do a UX design which is a no no in today’s tech savvy users.

Still waiting for the SMS to activate my account and have been waiting for 2 hours & gave up.

Waste of time & space !
developerResponse: {'id': 3319765, 'body': 'Hi there, thank you for your feedback which we have fed back to our developer team.', 'modified': '2018-05-02T00:49:31Z'}

review: Whenever I try and use the app there are ‘technical difficulties’. It’s literally never worked. Very frustrating when I’ve driven out of my way to find a BP.

title: Not recommended

review: I made a mistake of filling it up before opening the app (I think it would be reasonable to assume that most people would fumble - would be nice to have an option to select to pay for already filled up station). Also the app freeze up a few times during use.
