We’re continuously working with our developers to ensure the user experience is optimum and we’re exploring new innovation to bring to market this year.', 'modified': '2018-05-04T00:52:05Z'}
title: Easy to make mistake

review: App worked well, but still had to go in store to swipe velocity card to have the points registered, even though I paid with velocity!
title: Can’t use velocity card

review: Any chance of adding velocity card to gain points at same time?
title: Add velocity

review:
It would be great to link my velocity card to this payment method so I can earn points. Earning velocity points is one of the only reasons I use BP. Paying via this app, while a great idea, is not going to work for me until velocity is linked. 
The app has a good screenflow. Though it needs to be sped up quite a bit. Especially when you are at a busy servo.
title: Velocity points

review: I have setup up the app but it doesn’t link to your velocity card so I will still have to go into store to pay. The only time I’ll use the app if it gives me discounted fuel.
title: Can’t see the point

review: Haven’t been compelled to write a review for an app till now. Long setup process with no instructions as to how it works. Had driven all the way to BP as part of an Amex offer. Tried to pay after I pumped to find out you had to unlock it first. Absolute waste of my time. Deleting.
title: Pointless app

review: Not sure what the minimal product you were going for but clearly not very viable and almost unsafe to use. I used it once and scared to use because there was no time saved. More like wastes and he whole 20 min of anxiety waiting to receive some sort of confirmation that the payment was processed so I don’t have a police turning up at my door while constantly refreshing the app while driving. Yes. Very safe. The PO clearly missed the mark here. Not to mention the app not picking up the correct list of pumps and needing to force quit it to refresh the app. Go back and read what Minimum Valuable Product is and aim for that if you can’t update and introduce new features every scrum. Fire the PO and rehire someone who knows what they’re talking about. App deleted. You had your chance.
title: MVP Mumbo jumbo. Heads need to roll

review:
Used 5 times, the time pay by app takes way longer than normal payment process! Including 3 times I have to walk in store checking out what’s happening!! Plus most recently, the confirmation page in store got stucked before we move ahead.

Not sure which company developed the app, not sure how the testing tests got passed!! apparently huge performance improvement needs to be increased here!
title: Super Slow app, and always stucked

review: One of the worst apps I’ve ever used.
title: Poor development

review: Don’t seem to be able to add velocity number to earn points when buying fuel thru the app
title: Velocity

review: App worked quickly and very convenient, payment processed very quickly and was able to fill up and drive straight away.      The future is here 👍
title: Great app works great

review: Why can’t I use my BP fuel card through this App???
title: A BP App but cannot use the BP card

review:
Re-downloaded this app to see if Velocity support was added. Still no support. 
Velocity is the only reason I fill up at BP because my local independent is sometimes up to 20c pL cheaper.
Also, still no Wallet support for the velocity card, only card swipe. Even Woolworths supports the Wallet app for rewards.
title: Needs Velocity Support

review: I decided to download this app give it ago and once I had entered my card details I was automatically charged now I never read that it was going to charge me once my details where entered. I have now removed my card and account clearly trying to get more money.
title: No

review: why wont u allow velocity to be linked?!!
title: save time but no points

review: Need to add a feature so you can earn velocity points as well
title: No velocity points using app

review: App is fantastic and love it. However it needs to have velocity points associated with it. Being a regular BP customer I love my points. I want to use this app but can’t as I do t get my points and have to go in store to do this. Please somehow add the velocity membership to this app.
title: No Velocity Points

review: At the station I usually go to I mostly have issues with the app; I’m not sure if it’s because of where we live and if the connection is rubbish or if the staff in the servo actually have to do something, as in acknowledge me and unlock the pump or if it’s my version of the app. At a different location it worked quite well. Can someone tell me if it is just the staff at the local BP?

First of all Fantastic idea, I have 4 kids, so not having to take them all out of the car to pay us great!!

However I like velocity points and for some reason it is not included in the BPme app!!

I dunno what everyone is going on about the sign up process, this fine. 

If the credit card is fine then the pump should unlock straight away and pay at the end automatically rather than wait for the guy in the shop to press a button. When the shop is busy I’m sitting in my car waiting longer than waiting in the que. sometimes I went in the shop which then I had to get my kids out of the car anyway. One time I paid in the shop and and on the app because he said it didn’t go through!

So velocity, auto payment, then a 5 Star and maybe they can bring me out a coffee 😉 ahaha

Jamie
title: Great idea

review: Love the idea but it’s way too slow. From tapping on the app to getting the option to select a pump can take a few minutes. Same with payment. Way too long. How did this pass non functional testing?!?
title: Great idea but Too slow

review: Downloaded and registered but don’t ever use this app as it doesn’t enable you to earn Velocity frequent flyer points on your purchases.
title: No Velocity

review:
Tried the app to pay for my fuel. 
Setup takes way too long to complete. 
Anyhow
Tried to pay. And I filled prior to using the app not knowing you should use the app then fill. 
But attendant didn’t accept for 10 minutes... I even went in and lined up and could see the screen pop up with my request and hear the constant noise as I keep retrying my request. 

Then after all that drama. Turns out they don’t accept LPG fuels on it. Couldn’t find anywhere where it said that. And I don’t see why you can’t. $10 is $10 wether is log diesel or unleaded.
title: A long way to go

review: The app works well and the gps function is very handy, but this app is very, very slow. It’s a good minute or longer loading before the OK is given to fuel. If that wait time could be reduced it would be near perfect.
title: Works but needs speeding up!

review: This app is useless for LPG cars
title: Simonverydisappointed

review:
Used it for a second time. Slow to load, but worst thing is the payment isn’t processed until the guy behind the counter presses a button. 

No other customers around so after waiting several minutes walked in and got the guy to press the button so I could leave. 

Good idea but badly executed
title: Too slow and odd process

review: This is a rubbish effort for such a big company. Its not ready for use. Fingerprint login is flaky. The password and passcode recognition is not working. The password and passcode reset is not working. The app is supposed to speed up the service station experience. It slows it down. I’ll never use it again. By the looks of the ratings you guys are getting im not the only one who thinks you should try another career apart from App development.
title: Very poor app

review: App works well. But there is still no Velocity capability in the app?? This has been missing for some time now.... Will stop using if it doesn’t become available soon
title: Still no Velocity??

review: It really does take too long to process when wanting to fill up. Sometimes I’d rather go in and pay than wait!
title: Too long!

review: Won’t be using it until I can link my velocity card to the payment
title: Velocity

review:
Takes around 1 minute before you can start filling up. Very slow App. 
After filling I waited 5 minutes before having to go into the shop to get my pump signed off. 
Got abused by the person in the car behind me. 
This App needs a lot more refinement
title: Rubbish

review: Terribly slow. The set up of this app took forever. I made the mistake of trying to download and set up the app once I was already at the petrol station. 10minutes later and im still at the security question. The petrol station was busy so I just ended up filling up, getting my baby out of the car and going in to pay as it would have been quicker to do that in the first place rather than go through the whole process. I also chose to sign up through PayPal thinking it would link the payment methods, however the BP app still asked me for a card. Complete disaster of an app. I’ll stick to Caltex pay at pump. It’s so much easier with a baby and actually works every time quickly.
title: Such a slow a process

review: Is it just me or you just cannot connect this app with a Velocity frequent flyers card?
title: Velocity connectivity

review:
I like this app a lot so far but feel it has a ways to go.

- I’d love to see Velocity support added to it.
- The startup of the app takes longer then expected too.
- Sign in takes a long time.
- Be good to see support for Apple Pay added too.
title: Useful but could improve

review: Great app, simple and easy to use. Linked  my bank account and ready to go next time I refuel. Problem is there is no option to add a Virgin Velocity card to l earn points. Could this be added in future please? Thanks
title: Great

review: Loaded app but not used yet. Strange that I can’t load BPs own card into the app - have to go into store to use that.
title: Not able to add BP card to payment methods.

review: Needs to have velocity frequent flyer linked to the bp me app as well
title: Velocity Frequent Flyer

review: I was excited to see an update for this app. Finally I could get my fuel card to work and I wouldn't receive the "something went wrong" message. Sadly it wasn't to be. I still can't get past registering my fuel card. It's all too hard, app deleted.
title: Still doesn't work

review: I’ve attempted to create a account twice & twice I’ve been told there’s problems with login. Pointless!!
title: Unable to login

review: This is a revolutionary app. Easy to use and once you are familiar it very quick. Thanks BP!!!
title: Leader in innovation to market

review:
This app and the system is great in its concept but needs to be working faster.
At this stage it would be still a lot quicker doing the payment the old way ....Kurt
title: Too slow....

review: The app works quite well and is a great idea, I will probably use it a whole lot more if and when I can earn velocity points through the app.
title: Works well.

review: Please update so you can link velocity card to app, so I can continue earning points.
title: Missing my Velocity points!

review:
I was a bit nervous to use BPme but found it to be really easy and convenient and I’m not tech savvy. Wish it was around years ago when my kids were smaller. 
Needless to say my kids were teasing me telling me mum your going to be on crime stoppers you haven’t paid. But the receipt came through I think even before I left the garage. 🐨
title: Sandy

review: need work
title: need work

review:
Ths first time i used it i didnt realise i had to unlock the pump. So i actually put petrol in my car twice. It cost $1 everytime you use the app - i find that to be disgusting 
Secondly. The times that i have used it, it has taken FOREVERRRRRR to go through. And with a screaming new born baby, the last thing i want to do is sit in my car with a line of people waiting to fill up, while my app decides when its ready to say ‘yes’ all done!
title: Not a fan

review: I have been telling the staff for awhile now to get a loyalty app so they don't waste time with the card system... Just scan your phone and it adds the coffee's on and tells you when your up to a free one. Sometimes they are searching for the cards for awhile and que builds up in store.
title: Coffee time

review: I would use it again if I could link my velocity card on it so I can still earn the rewards on my fuel purchase as I visit BP at list 3 times a week
title: Easy to use and good concept

review: No way to add points using velocity
title: Velocity points

review: App works fine. I went through with the purchase assuming I could do the Velocity set up later. I specifically go to BP to get Velocity points, so it’s really disappointing that you haven’t got that sorted with the app from the start! With 2 little kids in the car an app like this is brilliant — but hurry up on the Velocity link! I am angry I missed out on $115 worth of points because I tried your app instead of going inside to pay.
title: Velocity points, come on!

review: Used the app twice. The first time it worked flawlessly, but the second time it couldn’t find the petrol station I was at (which by the way is the same station the first time). Also not happy that you can’t add your velocity membership.
title: Hmmm

review: It is disappointing to find out that the app do not allow you to record your Velocity Frequent Flying Membership Number to collect the rewards. I personally only fill up at BP to get point on my velocity frequent flyer points. It is not worth filling at BP if there is no rewards. Might as well fill up at Shell with Flybuys or at Costco Petrol outlet (cheapest at all times) or go the local independent to keep competition alive. Please let me know when you have fixed the app to be include this basic option.
title: No way to earn Velocity point from using the app

review:
The app works fine, accept that you have to login with your email address and password, instead you should be able to use Apple Touch ID to authenticate.

By the time you have typed in all of your details, you would be quicker to go to the store and “tap & go” with your credit card.

Very poor use of existing technology.
title: Poor authentication

review: Used this for the first time yesterday.  Once finished filling we sat and waited and then realised the app froze. Had to go instore to pay and then come back for the phone to show app froze. Not a great first experience maybe you need to add a complement to say your done
title: App froze

review:
Finally set up and looks a great idea, but I won’t be using this app. 
I will be going in to pay so I can scan my velocity card first and get the points. They all count up.
title: No Velocity?

review:
I think it is getting better used to be much worse. Unfortunately doesn’t work for all Bp petroleum stations.
However, It is a convenient way to pay for fuel without having to go to pay to register 
Especially when you have kids in the car
Thank you
title: A bit slow but convenient

review: To me this app is perfect but I can’t use it as it has no integration with velocity frequent flyer program. The only read to fill up at BP is the ability to get velocity points. If they get this issue sorted, i can’t see any reason why I wouldn’t use this app all the time.
title: No velocity points!

review:
Constructive feedback - hopefully!

The only reason I shop at BP is for Velocity points as I value being able to do this. Ironically I went to set myself up and there was no Velocity link option which I find very strange. 

I then read the reviews from many users and the responses from BP - it is great that BP are reading and responding however I would suggest to BP that the reason for using the app is to save time. Therefore as you have suggested, walking into the store to get the Velocity points defeats the purpose of the app in the first place. It might be worth one of one or two of the app developers to go out and use the app to see the customer experience before launching.
title: Not a seamless experience

review:
Chose the sign up with PayPal option.
When it kicks me back to the app I get a message saying I already exist and to sign in. No option to sign in with PayPal, other than go through registration process again. Which bounces me through the above again. 

Didn’t get to set a password for the app itself. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling again, and same happens.
title: Weird loop prevents me signing up

review: You are not eligible to receive velocity point when you pay through the app. Also made the mistake of filling up before opening the app.
title: Can’t receive velocity points

review:
Have tried this app 3 times, wasting 5 mins at the pump each time and holding people up, and it hasn’t worked out. 
Staff in the station no help at all.
title: Tried, tried and tried again but it never works

review: Waste of time for me, the only reason I go to BP is for the Velocity points, it’s certainly not for the low fuel prices
title: No Option to earn Velocity points

review: Takes forever to setup and longer to load/login. Can walk to the next town over and pay before this app wakes up and gets going.. poor..
title: Rubbish

review: Clunky st the servo - especially if you need to change pumps - seems to take $1 to verify your payment each time, emails receipts but no history in the app
title: Clunky and needs optimizing

review: What a rip, charge me $1 transaction fee to use the app. I’ll just support the dude at the cash register by paying the old fashion way
title: $1 transaction fee

review: Stuck in a continuous cycle saying this ‘email already exists’, when I registered through PayPal. No way to change registration, email billing, tried 2 separate email/PayPal accounts. Gave up after 7 times with the same message after PayPal already accepted to register. Unimpressed.
title: Buuugged off

review:
This app is a great idea however....it continually keeps asking for the full Username and Password at each and every fill.😣
Considering the app lives on a registered phone with verified payment details, this is crazy. 
Please give us a 4 key code and let us get on with it. 🙏✅
title: BPme

review: There is no where to add my velocity rewards card
title: Velocity points

review:
Good app and easy to use, first time driving away felt strange by not physically going in store but I’m getting used to it now. 
Please in future updates have ability to add out virgin velocity card to the account. 
Thank you
title: Convenient

review:
Sends me a code, i input said code. Says code is invalid. Re tried 10 times.

Don’t bother downloading
title: Doesnt verify

review: Set up takes far too long; don’t do it while you have a screaming child in the car. Also requests to hold $1 prior. Deleted immediately.
title: Don’t bother

review: Can’t even get the App started without it rejecting the UserName and Password given and reset many times ... I’m switching to Shell now - Go Well, Go Shell!!
title: Terrible App! Poorly Developed!

review:
It’s a little bit slow and clunky for my liking but at the end of the day it gets the job done so I have no problems there. 
There should also be the option to link your velocity card to the account, there’s no way to do that at the moment.
title: Bit clunky, but gets the job done

review: It takes long time to open the app. Twice I stopped using the app because of long loading time. Developers need to work on it.
title: Takes ages to open the app

review: I can’t get past the security part because it won’t accept any of the pin codes that I’m being texted. Same goes for trying to log in using PayPal! Needs some serious bug fixes.
title: I cannot even log in!

review:
Face ID never works, pin says incorrect when correct! 
If it takes longer to get into the app than going down to pay then what’s the use. I have tried it 3 times now and each time I had an issue logging in! 
Absolutely useless!
title: Terrible!

review: Have given this app more than a fair go! Have used many times and just about every time I’ve had problems.  Either way too slow or just refuses to open.  This morning was the final nail.  Stopped 100 yards from the servo as I know it can take a bit of time.  Tried to open the app, Touch ID did not work.....”please enter pin”.  The same pin I’ve used for years!  “Incorrect pin”.....Try again “Incorrect pin”.  Ok, re-set pin.  Pin re-set, try again......”Incorrect pin”.  Try to re-set pin AGAIN.  “Sorry an error occurred”.  Got to work, deleted the app, re-install.  Now won’t let me log on?  That’s it!  Now permanently deleted, life’s too short for this, an app that’s supposed to make life easier?  I’m off to Caltex.
developerResponse: {'id': 2669538, 'body': 'Hi The Jeweller, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid. This will be released by your financial provider. The time it takes will vary depending on the card issuer or bank. We suggest you contact your bank directly if you have further questions. Thanks for your interest in BPme. Cheers.', 'modified': '2018-02-24T22:08:13Z'}
title: Absolute Garbage

review:
Wish I could rate this app minus stars!! It does not work. 
Would be great if it did work, as having small children and having to take them out of their car seats every time I go in to pay for fuel can be a challenge!
title: DOES NOT WORK

review: This is a good concept but there were countless bugs while signing up. It took ages and it definitely needs to be streamlined.
title: Terrible signing up process

review: Not that useful if you have to go into store to get velocity reward points. 😩😩
title: Reward Points

review: 5 stars for the service it potentially offers minus 2 stars because it takes so long to load. I’m on a fairly recent iPhone but I’m sitting in the forecourt for a minute or two while it launches, then it asks for my fingerprint, then “something goes wrong” so it asks for my PIN. I know it has to launch a few services and search my location etc but seriously. It needs to be FASTER than ducking into the shop, not slower.
Too long to set up and doesn't allow you to claim velocity points which is one of the main reasons to fuel up at BP I'm the first place - delete until solved.
title: Rubbish

review: As a student, there are other places I could go for petrol, but I insist on shopping at BP for the frequent flyer points. The app itself is a great function especially when it’s cold or quite a warm day. But the biggest let down for me is the functionality to collect Velocity points. I have used the app twice, first when it was released and secondly last week. I would have expected that by now the functionality would be working as I saw comments from BP on the day it launched explaining the Velocity functionality would be looked into further, once the app market had grown.. I think BP needs to give a little more to get.
title: I only use BP for Velocity points.

review: For ages I’ve been taking my chances with Caltex’s pay at pump which half the time does not work, but BPme has not missed a beat since I started using it and I can do the Payment from within the car.
title: As a mum of 2 I love this

review:
Process is very slow, sometimes the operator keep on denying the request. And make a gesture to come in the store.. 
deleting the app  now.
title: Very slow processing

review:
Shame there is no option to add my velocity details here to earn points. It’s the main reason I fill up at BP. With a newborn baby this app is handy, but I won’t use it until
I can also earn points for my fuel like I do in store
title: Needs rewards program compatibility

review: The app has worked every time I’ve used it. However, as others have already mentioned, it takes time to load and verify.
title: Decent, but a bit slow

review: A great and convenient idea, but I won't be using it until I can add my Velocity Frequent Flyer number so I can still earn points.
title: Velocity FF

review:
A “verification” charge every time seems odd.

This solution has the feel of something that is patched together rather than a solid solution. Plus the app is excruciatingly slow. 

Like the idea, not going to touch it.
title: $1 charge every time, not part of the payment

review:
I registered for Touch ID and passcode login.. Current the app isn’t asking me for my fingerprint, just asks for passcode.. And as soon as I put in my CORRECT passcode, it keeps telling me that it’s failed to log in as the passcode is incorrect.. So then I follow the link for “forgotten passcode”.. I reset my passcode and again.. Input the “new” passcode and it still continues to tell me that it’s incorrect. 

I currently can’t use this app at all because it won’t let me in!! Hence my 1 Star!
title: Passcode doesn’t let me in

review:
Now 8 months since trying this app and still not able to add reward card information to a petrol purchase. 
Without the rewards then i will shop around for my petrol
BP’s marketing analytics department are stoopid.
developerResponse: {'id': 2105191, 'body': "Hi Team Bondi, we're sorry to hear you had this experience. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T04:12:12Z'}
title: Is it so hard to include reward information

review: Love this idea but the reason I fill up at BP is to earn velocity points. Still very disappointed that you can’t earn velocity points with the app. Has stopped me from using it
title: Great idea but needs velocity

review: App works ok, but when will the option of using Velocity card be included in the app? Until that happens,I won’t be using the app
title: What about Velocity???

review: What’s the point of being able to use this at the service station if you can’t claim Velocity points at the same time. I still have to go into the counter to swop my card to receive the points.
title: Pointless app

review: Would use the app if it linked to Velocity card, have to swipe V card in store. Can you make it so we can link account with a Velocity member No.?
title: Surfnsgr8

review:
The app was fantastic to start with,
But can no longer log in with face ID on iPhone X, have to manually type in user and password and then answer security question, face ID tab is enabled in settings, by the time you sit in the vehicle doing this it's quicker to just go and pay in the station.
title: Disappointed 😳

review: I registered with my paypal and then use the info to log in, it says username or password is wrong, then tried start all over again with my email, same problem happened. Wasting of time, really disappointed.
title: Good idea but NEVER WORK

review: The app itself is good although often very slow to load. But what I really want to see is to be able to link it to my velocity card. Please!
title: Need to link to velocity

review: Keeps asking for pin. Have reset multiple times, even with different pin codes, but it will not accept.
title: Pin doesn’t work

review: Recently it is asking for pin, i tried to reset many time but it is nor working.
title: Pin error

review: When selected a station before arriving was advised on app that BPMe was available but when at the station was informed that its coming soon.  Very frustrating.
title: Available Stations

review: Love this app, so good not having to go into store, however updated today, and now can’t log on, and doesn’t open with face recognition.
title: Not working since updating 12 July 18

review:
I had become a big BP user just due to location and price . I was stoked when this app came out as I prefer to do all my purchases on the phone , Apple Pay, Paypal or via the vendors app.

Besides being painfully slow ( ok may be teething issues) , every upgrade has required me to re login ( I already have to login in to the phone , and I’ve already authenticated via the app) but now it’s asking for a pin when I’d set it up for fingerprints .

This is getting so frustrating to use I’m considering giving up on bp all together
title: Thinking of changing back to another vendor

review:
Downloaded the app and worked without any problems, BUT it wasn’t until I used it a few times I realised that I was not able to get my velocity points! So I still have to walk inside??
BP and velocity were hand in hand aren’t they?
Needs a connection so you can put your velocity card into the app.
title: Velocity ???

review: Having installed this app thanks to the massive marketing push at every BP, it continues to disappoint.  Byron Bay Ewingsdale has been a fail over a dozen times and staff appear to have zero idea why.  Get it working, or remove the endless advertising as you are setting up customers for disappointment.
title: Worst App, waste time everytime

review:
Set up was nice and easy, completed within 5min. 
Is there any way of linking my Velocity card? It’s kinda the only reason I go to BP (and the coffee)
title: Velocity?

review: The set up is long and horrible and they don’t tell you you can’t earn velocity points using this app. The most concerning feature is I can’t  see any way of deleting my account. From a security point of view I’m sorry I downloaded this app
title: Not good

review: A clunky set up process. Since you no longer go in store and this app does not link your Velocity account which means you won’t earn points. The first time I used this app to pay for petrol I sat wondering if the transaction was completed because there is no notification. Recommend informing user that the transaction is complete and you can drive away without the police knocking on your door for stealing and not paying for fuel.
title: Good once set up. No Velocity points

review:
Initial set up was very painful. After getting set up it rarely signed in when needed. When it would sign in the in store part of the process took longer than it would take to just walk in. People behind you are also inconvenienced while waiting for this whole process to ultimately fail most of the time. 
Now I can not use Touch ID to sign in and am being informed my password is not correct even though I even went so far as to reset it. 
Whoever developed this app should look for a new career as app development is clearly not your strong point. If there was a way to give less than one star I would.
title: Worst app I have ever used

review:
This was a handy app until the last update that removed the fingerprint login and replaced it with a PIN. I didn’t receive any communication saying that there was a change to the login. I have tried to set a new PIN twice now and it still doesn’t let me log in. 
Great app but just not seamless to use.
title: Fingerprint and PIN

review: Charges to use $1
title: Scam

review:
Unable to claim Velocity points using app. 
How hard could that be to set up.
Will be deleting app
title: No Velocity Points

review: Useless.  After setting it up it doesn’t accept my PIN which I have changed three times to make sure. It also doesn’t ask for my Face ID even though it is enabled, so I can’t access the app. They probably haven’t coded and integrated the PIN and Face ID correctly. Maybe BP should stick to simpler things like drilling oil.
title: Doesn’t work on iPhone X

review: If you are a Velocity reward card holder you will miss out on points if you use this app. It takes a minute or two to use which would be fine if it was reliable but sometimes it just doesn’t work. So now I just always pay instore.
title: Unreliable, does not allow Velocity reward points

review: I have created an account with paypal, verified, tried to log in and then it makes me change my password and then I go to log in again and it goes back to the log in page. I have attempted several times. Might wanna sort out your app before you advertise on TV.
title: I can’t log in

review: Title says it all. PIN does not work, reset it twice. Doesn’t work. So I assume the app is useless now ?
title: PIN Reset does not work

review: This is a great app when it actually works, even when we have plenty of reception it still takes forever to load each page..it's quicker to just go in and pay for it.
title: So sloooowwwww

review:
This app was so great, allowed me to pay for fuel without having to leave my car, and saved me getting my newborn in and out of the vehicle. 
Since the latest update. I’ve lost the ability to use faceunlock and it now asks for a pin. Which doesn’t work. So twice I’ve updated pin, but still comes up as incorrect. 
FAIL BP. Fix your app. You’ve lost me and countless others with this update issue.
title: Used to be handy

review: I love the idea of this but it seems to depend on the specific servo. My local one takes forever to release the pump and so long for the payment to process I end up walking into the cashier anyway to see what’s going on. I’ve actually just deleted it entirely because it won’t take my fingerprint anymore and wants the PIN, which I forgot, changed, then had it rejected again next time I used it. Frustrating because it’s a great idea. I’ll reinstall it when I get around to it and try again.
title: Great when it works

review: Biggest issue is unlike others there is no fuel prices, why? Also with the maps why do we need to use 2 fingers to move the map which goes against all other map apps we use?
title: No prices!

review: Used to work well for me with Face ID on my iPhone X. But now Face ID doesn’t come up at all and it asks for my PIN, which I have reset multiple times and still says it is incorrect. I have been going to fill up at a more conveniently located service station of another brand whilst this issue is persisting.
title: Worked ok, now not at all.

review: I used this 2 or 3 times and it was great. But the last few times I have used it, the app didn't load and it was faster to go inside and pay! A bit useless if I still have to go inside.
title: Not useful

review: I love the idea behind this app,  but it just doesn’t work.  The first time I tried to use it, I wound up having to go inside to pay and the second time I tried to use it I had to log in and put my details in all over again and wound up going inside to confirm that it had worked (it took two tries) and whether payment had been taken.  To be honest, I wish they had just done paywave at the pump instead, the app itself is not user friendly and has no real benefit.
title: Great idea, terrible app

review: App is soo slow!! Someone else got to the petrol station after me, they filled and paid in store whilst I was still filling due to the app being so slow. If the purpose of this app is to speed things up then it has failed miserably. To make things worse it wasn’t recognising a pin which I never setup due to the use of Touch ID and regardless of how many times I reset the pin it didn’t recognise it, at the end I had to sign out and then in back in to get it working.
title: Good idea but poorly executed

review: I’m sure BP can spare a few bucks to make this app actually function.
title: How is it as bad as it is?

review: Really makes my life easy. So easy to set-up, no freezing etc. Would like to have virgin points linked that would be sweet. I’m bound to BP and very happy. A future shareholder 😀
title: Pleased as whiskey punch

review:
I downloaded this app the day it came out and it has been awesome. Easy set up and user friendly... until something went wrong.

I ALWAYS used the fingerprint access (iPhone) to log in, however today it said I had to put in a pin... which I had never set up before. Due to that, I had to press the “reset pin” link to register a pin. It then referred me to an email, which sent me online to register a pin. I did this, opened the app back up, entered my pin, BUT it said that the pin was incorrect...
So I reset it again, and again, and again... nothing still - always “wrong pin” 😩
I tried logging out of the app and then back in, but it wouldn’t work. 🤬
So I just went in and paid in person.
I told the ladies behind the counter, but they had no idea what to do.
The one who served me said “oh well, at least you get your velocity points instead of nothing at all” hmmm - not the point.

The only way I could fix it was by deleting the app from my phone and then reinstalling the app. Then login back in and now it is back to asking for my fingerprint not a pin code.

Again, I have had absolutely no issues regarding this app for many months. It was only this one time where it went bizarre.
title: Excellent... most of the time

review: Don’t know what happened. I’ve been using this app for a while on iPhone X using Face ID. Suddenly, it stopped using Face ID even though it’s enabled in the app settings and asks for a pin which no matter how many times I reset it, says it’s incorrect. What happened???
developerResponse: {'id': 4496854, 'body': 'We really want it to work for you! If you drop a note to aucustcare@bp.com with details, we’ll help get it sorted.', 'modified': '2018-08-02T00:19:25Z'}
title: Used to work great but now... not so much

userName: Ma Que bien este Album - Powerhouse rock, melodias country, voces muy bonitas...
review: Used for first time today. Worked great and no frustrating queues etc to pay for Petrol. Nice idea!
title: Like it

review: Since the update two weeks ago it is impossible to get past the sign in screen with the four digit pin, even if you reset it.
developerResponse: {'id': 4496846, 'body': 'We really want it to work for you! If you drop a note to aucustcare@bp.com with details about what’s not working, we’ll help get it sorted.', 'modified': '2018-08-02T00:18:45Z'}
title: App doesn’t work

review: App takes along time to activate the pump and then after finishing takes even longer to do the payment. App crashed and had to go into store for payment at ballan Vic.
title: Slow and crashes

review: So... we’ve had a few updates, but there’s really not a lot of improvement. I eventually registered (after my last review), but now the login takes foreveeeer if successful at al. It’s quicker to walk in to the shop and pay. Shane really; a great idea badly executed
developerResponse: {'id': 2556153, 'body': "Hi Stevie, we're sorry to hear you had this experience. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience. If you can provide a screen grab to aucustcare@bp.com with the error message you received we will be able to investigate further. Cheers", 'modified': '2018-02-12T03:38:15Z'}
title: Hello dev team?

review: Waste of time
title: Hopelessly slow system

review:
Sorry, as much as I’d like this to work & to use it for the convenience, it has been nothing but a disappointment:
* Three tanks in a row I got a “You don’t seem to be near a station” message (when within sight of it)
* Each time, after entering the pump number, I got “Sorry we’re having technical issues, please pay inside” errors. When I go inside, the staff have no idea if the app is working or not, and just shrug. 
So sorry guys, unless it’s quicker & more convenient, this app has for me failed its test. I’ll go back to my local (competitor) servo
title: Drive on

review: I find the app ok but u can’t use it for lpg which is a pain as most of my vehicles are used on lpg not petrol.
title: It’s ok

review: Just spent 20 mins trying to get this app to work, in the end me and my 14 month old daughter got drenched as I had to go into pay. Will be avoiding BP stations in the future and use the stations with the chip and pin at the pump.
title: Awful

review: Tho needs velocity point card built in...
developerResponse: {'id': 2737119, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for advising, we have informed our developers. Unfortunately the app can only be used at a BP site from inside your car or in the store and as such you cannot use BPme to fill your motorbike.', 'modified': '2018-03-04T22:34:30Z'}
title: Good app

review: At first the app worked fine although a little slow to locate where you were and unlock the pump - now it asks for a PIN, enter the PIN and it says its wrong (I know it isn’t) - reset PIN, restart app, still says PIN is wrong - I’m deleting the app
developerResponse: {'id': 4527673, 'body': "We're so sorry to hear that you've had this experience. Please email aucustcare@bp.com and our support team will get back to you.", 'modified': '2018-08-06T00:31:13Z'}
title: Poorly Done

review: For the last few weeks it keeps asking for a pin then comes up with an error saying incorrect pin. Even if you reset the pin you still get the same error.  Don’t waste your time on this app.
title: Annoyed

review: This is a great app and idea but I won't use it till I can also earn velocity points too. Is this feature on the roadmap?
title: Velocity points

review: I rather like app, and I do still use it. However, if I’m in a rush or if the station is rather busy, I tend to just fill up and run inside to pay as it seems quicker. I feel like other customers think I’m just sitting in the car playing on my phone arrogantly holding everyone up. I’ve tried getting it ready ahead of time, but it doesn’t work because you have to be at the petrol station to initiate the transaction. If the app ran about 3X as fast as it does, I wouldn’t hesitate to give it five stars. It really is a great app, and once the speed issue is resolved it will be perfect.
title: It is just so slow...

review: How I can add my velocity rewards card with the app or it not supported yet?
title: Velocity rewards

review: Keeps saying incorrect PIN. Tried resetting PIN but still the same problem. Email customer service but they can’t help unless I have account number(email doesn’t count they say). But I was never given an account number to start? Always used my email to login?
title: Won’t let me login.

review: Tried to log in and set up PayPal. Just kept going around in circles! Deleted the app.
title: Totally hopeless

review: It’s definitely a great idea and time saver, and especially good if you have young kids. I’ve used it many times now with no issues. Can you please just have an option to link your velocity card to the app. It’s the only thing letting it down for me. Thank you
title: It’s great but....

review:
App is way tooooo slow to go through the whole fueling lifecycle - it is quicker to go into store and tap and pay. App locked me out as well and would not take my PIN even though I had reset it to the same one several times.
Now I’ve been burnt using the app not sure I would go back to it if it was fixed 
Spoke with others who have same issue as well.
title: Slow Slow Slow

review:
Very lengthy process to set up but does work. 
Very embarrassing when I left service station thinking I had paid for fuel then got a message on the app said that payment had failed after two days of ringing BP I found out that the app doesn’t work with LPG  due to length of time to fill up with LPG
title: Does not work with LPG

review: You can’t get points towards your velocity card?
title: That App is ok but missing important features

review: It let me select the bp fuel station and then it gives me the ‘we are experiencing technical problems’ bs. I tried again a few days later and same problem. I still filled my car up at your station since I was already there so I guess you got me twice.
title: it doesn’t work

review:
This app needs to apgrade more...
Please link our velocity card to our account....
It doesn’t make sense that i paid my BPMe through the app using my velocity card amd earning ZERO points, i still need to get off from my car and go to the cashier... hope this issue will be resolved soon....
Thank you
title: Ok app...

review: Bery bad app.. never worked. Took ages to logon and when successful it doesn’t show the BP station, despite being less than 5km away. Such a waste of time/effort!!
title: Never worked!!

review: Why can’t a BP Fuel Card be used?
developerResponse:
{'id': 4637984, 'body': "Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

BP has a dedicated app for BP Plus card holders called ‘BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme’, which has unique features and benefits for our BP Plus card customers.

At present, the app is not available for BP Plus cards issued from large fleet, leasing and salary sacrifice companies. Communication will be sent out from your BP Plus card issuer when this feature is available. 

You can read more about the' BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme' on the website https://www.bp.com/en_au/australia/products-services/bpme/bpme-for-bp-plus.html

If you have any further queries regarding BPMe, please contact us as below.

Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPMe)", 'modified': '2018-08-14T01:01:49Z'}
title: Why can’t a BP Fuel Card be used?

review: After using the app for months I’ve stopped as it is faster to walk inside the store and pay than wait ages for the pump to be unlocked (and a few times it has not been) and then sit inside the car waiting for the payment to be processed.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4787840, 'body': 'Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

Sorry for the inconvenience. It sounds as though you were at one of our independently owned and operated BP stations. This means that payment methods may differ from other BP service stations. Can you advise of the station so we can pass your feedback on to the owner.

If you have any further queries regarding BPme, please contact us as below.


Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)', 'modified': '2018-08-24T00:48:53Z'}
title: Slow and unreliable

review: Unfortunately there are no Virgin Frequent flyer rewards able to be linked which is a real shame. Why would you use the app when you still need to go into the store if you want to get the points? Come on folks.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4637970, 'body': 'Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

BPme was introduced as a fuel payment method to help customers save time. BPme is always under development and we aim to introduce new features and offers in due course to make your life at the pump easier.

At present you can only use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP.

Unfortunately Velocity Frequent Flyer isn’t able to award points retrospectively if you have attempted to accumulate points through the app.

If you have any further queries regarding BPme, please contact us as below.


Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)', 'modified': '2018-08-14T00:59:12Z'}
title: No virgin rewards??

review: Set up time is too lengthy. Need to display clear cut instructions for customers when it’s downloaded and used for the first time. I used the Caltex app yesterday and the transaction was so smooth. Thought BP WOULD BE EVEN MORE SMOOTHER. But I ended up paying for my fuel and the guy after me. I understood the situation and my fault pretty soon and was able to get the money off the other guy. Would definitely give it another go. This happened at glenrowan south at 11.33 am. Pump #13

title: Velocity points? No.

review: I was optimistic with this app at first but after 4 pretty bad experiences in a row, I won’t be using it again. I always experience issues with either the pump being unlocked or the app taking too long to process the payment. After completing filling up I could go inside, pay and drive about a km before the payment goes through. I appreciate the idea but it’s poorly executed and I wouldn’t recommend this app to anyone.

title: Slow and and wastes more time than it saves

review: Per the other reviews, the concept is good but the execution very poor. And the lack of linking to Velocity is a real error of judgement in terms of what to launch, when. The whole Agile / Scrum piece of ‘just get it out there’ irrespective of what functionality can be achieved and the slickness of the experience for the user is very much a misstep. Improving the set up would be an easy fix. Just have a few steps laid out for the user as a guide maybe, as it’s not obvious you will receive an email to continue the set up process when you have used PayPal to set up initially so you go round in circles a bit.
developerResponse:

title: Waste of time

review:
Initial sign up process was over onerous. 

My biggest complaint is how long it takes from when you pull along a pump, start the app waiting for it to prompt you to sign in (I use Touch ID) then select the pump. 

Imagine on a busy day the frustration from other drivers behind you, they see you sit in the car for a minute or two before getting out and pumping fuel? 

The app was meant to be a convenience feature so make it faster and truly convenient.

title: Good concept but needs improvement

review: Don’t bother with this app, you spend longer fighting with it than if you had just walked up to pay (you have to get out of the car to fill up anyway). It tries to solve the problem we have nowadays with lining up, except that in this apps case it doesn’t save you any time as you can’t preorder, you have to be at the pump and you have to wait for the operator to be available to enable the pump. If the operator is available to do so then they weren’t busy to begin with so the 5 minutes you wait for the app to handshake and enable the pump, you may as well have been filling and just walk in and pay. Truly useless app.
developerResponse:

Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)', 'modified': '2018-08-24T00:43:43Z'}
title: Waste of Time

review:
Aside from the key fact that this app saves you no time or money like other apps (most notably Caltex’s 6c/L app saving & 3-tap functionality), this app takes ages to set up, but doesn’t allow you to link your Velocity card to get points.
Also not all BP stations work with this app, just like not all BP stations can accept your Velocity card. Seems like BP are just hit & miss in general.

{'id': 4787810, 'body': 'Hi there,

title: Can’t use velocity...???!!!

review: Today I used your app, second time the app hasn’t worked for me. Great concept but created a lot more hassle for me. I drove out of my way so I didn’t need to get sleeping baby or 5yo out of the car. Payment didn’t go through and not wanting to get kids out of car I drove away from pump to store and called BPMe. I was advised they were having issues with PayPal payments and they’d send me a text as I wouldn’t be able to pay in store (confirmed by app) and I just pay them by directions on text. I later received a message from police to explain why I allegedly stole petrol. This was very stressful for me to have to explain this to the police in front of my children. I was told to go back to the station to pay. I am a busy working mother of 2 and when trying to save time and make my life a little easier it has actually been quite distressing and a lot of extra work me. Not worth the hassle.

title: Awesome Concept

review: So I’ve used the app twice. A bit slow but perhaps saved some time paying when the cashier was busy. Third time I try it there’s a hitch! It tells me my transaction was declined after filling up. So I go in to the servo to pay. Cashier tells me all is good, system says it was paid, despite the email from BP. So I walk out and drive home. I pay within 2 hours but get hit with a recovery fee of $3!! Recovery of what BP? You got your money within 2 hours and would have had it within 30 seconds if your system was better. And you didn’t reply to my complaint email. Stop ripping people off! Can’t see me taking a chance to use the system again...

It will also charge your card with the fuel for the person after you if you don’t cancel your unlocked pump.
So it has potential, but has not been useful to me so far.

title: Register with PayPal doesn’t work

review:
Only get a +91 option for my mobile area code so can’t reset password with mobile

Registered with PayPal never got to set a password my PayPal password doesn’t work and I didn’t receive the password reset email
title: Can’t reset password with mobile

review:
This app is amazing if you’re getting petrol and don’t want to/can’t go in to the service station to pay (baby in the car/ feeling antisocial/in your pyjamas etc). Can pay through PayPal so it’s easy and safe.  But it can be cumbersome until you figure out how best to use it. 

Tip:
Have the app running as you’re driving to the station. Then it has “located” the station by the time you drive up to it. Means you don’t have to wait around, once you’re parked, for the app to find the station and/or pumps. Speeds up the process!
title: Once you work out it’s quirks, it’s amazing!

review: In every petrol station in qld the lpg pump is not available?? Can you fix it?
title: LPG pumps not showing

review: Took me a couple of goes to get the process right but pretty easy to use and saved going into the shop if you don’t need anything else. Is there a plan to add the ability to record odometer readings when filling up using the app?
title: Odometer reading

review: How soon till velocity is linked. I am reluctant to use the app until it is
title: Waiting for Velocity to be linked

review: This app never works and is frustratingly slow. Sack your Devs already and find someone who can actually deliver.
title: Sack your Devs

review: Quick and easy filling :)
title: Love it

review:
Updated the review since I was able to successfully pay for my petrol. 

There is a lot of anxious waiting when using this app:
- waiting to login and be able to select a pump
- once the pump is selected, there is a longer waiting time for the pump to be “unlocked”
- after filling up, the longest wait was for the transaction to take place, which is the worst wait of all since 1) there is no other button/option to press so you’re just hoping your payment goes through, and 2) people are still unused to just getting straight into their cars without paying for petrol first. 

Similar to my initial sentiment, I would prefer to just pay for petrol the old-fashioned way than to use this app, unless I choose to remain in the car with the kids, eg thunderstorms. On a hot day I would probably take them out with me rather than to sit in the car that I cannot run the ignition on as I’ll be using the phone. 

Having said this, I’ll still keep an eye for future improvements as it does have potential. Thank you. 

##########
Original review:
I, too, had high hopes for this app as it would potentially allow me to pay for petrol without having to take my kids out of the car, but testing it out by myself I could not get it to work; specifically it would give me a “technical error” when selecting a pump and ask me to try again, but it never worked so I ended up walking in to pay. 
I would like to echo other people’s experiences that it just takes too long with the engine off before you can even fill up (when it works, that is) so, until that is remediated, again I would not be considering using this with children in the car.
I look forward to trying out the next version; hopefully BP will keep investing in this app.
title: When it works, it requires a lot of waiting in the car

review: If only the app would let you connect before you are near the station or just at a greater distance then this would save heaps of time, I often get my partner to load app before arriving so it actually saves more time and is worth it.please broaden the finding nearest station function so it works within at least 500m so you can load before arriving:)
title: Suggestion for area for great improvement

review:
The idea is great but every time this app talks to a server it is just too dang slow. Good idea let down by poor infrastructure. 

I swear I can walk into the store and tap and pay quicker than using this thing.
title: Good idea but slow

review: I have a BP fuel card which has one extra digit compared with a standard card. This means I cannot input the card number making the app useless to me.
title: Won’t work with fuel card

review: It’s nearly there. I started using the app which was great UNTIL I realised I still have to go in to the station to swipe my velocity card!!! Shame, I’ve told BP the first week when the app came out.
title: Velocity card

review: This app seems great, I can find stations easily and can distinguish between ones which do and don’t accept the BPme app for payment. However, I will not be using this app as I cannot find anywhere to link/enter your Virgin Velocity account number to accumulate points.

review: Good idea for an app but considering I go out of my way to visit BP due to their relationship with Velocity, it’s not great.
title: No velocity link

review: Needs support for Velocity Rewards ASAP
title: No Velocity Reward support

review: It was bad enough finding outlets where my velocity card would actually work. And since this flaw represents another example of poor customer service will also look other brands as they are often cheaper.
title: No velocity points - dumping the app

review: But instead I had to agree to a privacy policy that can sell my information to marketing and other related businesses at any time for any reason. Some feedback for you BP, would be to revise your privacy policies and make them suitable just for paying for fuel rather than anything else.
title: Just wanted to pay for fuel

review: Really disappointed that I couldn’t link my velocity rewards card....

review: What is going on here, 3 attempts to verify and now the app won’t load. Not a good start to a relationship guys

Went inside to ask the attendant and was advised the app doesn’t work at this franchise store yet... so if not working why does the app have a tick to say it is working at this store? Waste my time.

review: Was excited to try this app out on my refuel yesterday but it would just not work! It detected my location fine but wouldn’t let me pick my fuel pump number. Just kept throwing the technical error screen! Waste of phone memory.

Rubbish so far. 0 stars would be more appropriate.

review:

review: you still need to go in store if you want to use your Virgin Velocity card for points. the app is good in theory but far too immature for it to be used by the masses. it’s a start at least and props to BP for trying.

title: Would be good to integrate Velocity points into the App.

review: Great idea especially with kids but shame you haven’t linked Virgin Points to it yet. I’m missing out on heaps
title: Great idea

review:
I loved this app the first few times I used it, but it became a bit hit n miss. Sometimes I would pull up at the station and the app wouldn’t work, and it came to be that it failed more often than it worked. 
I tried to submit feedback through the app and it failed too!
title: Doesn’t always work

review:
Rock up at a petrol station Forestville , drive to pump 7 , but there is only 6 pumps to choose from on the app . 

Happened a few times at various stations
title: 6 pump options but I used pump 7 , smart

review: It’s not clear on removing expired cards. All cards have a tick, can’t remove the tick or expired cards. Tried to leave a review through the app, but it “failed to submit ”
title: Not everything works

review:
I have been using this App for a few months and it can gone well until recently. A charge for fuel was duplicated and it has taken an enormous amount of effort to try and have it reversed with no luck. Unfortunately I have had to escalate it as a disputed with my bank. I would highly caution putting your credit card details into the App as if you get double charged you will have terrible and inconvenience customer service from BP. There is a supposed phone number to call however BP Me is not an option and it is impossible to get a human on the line. 
I will no longer be using this App.
title: Duplicate transactions

review: App was all set up. Went to purchase fuel at a suburban service station in capital city and it was not set up at this site. The app does not state this until you are already at the service station. With two children in the car under two, needless to say I was not impressed. If you can’t provide the service, at least make people aware of this before arriving at the petrol station.
title: Not available locally

review: Seems like a good idea but won’t use it as I can’t earn virgin rewards points using it
title: Pointless without the ability to earn virgin points

review: Finally what we actually need. I am not antisocial/ shy however I do have a new baby and a toddler. With Australia’s laws of not allowing us to leave our kids in the car which I fully support, It’s so much easier to pay for petrol in the car and drive away that way I am assured that my kids are safe near me and it’s so so so simple.
title: Amazing app! Other petrol providers need to keep up!

review: Great for tax time no more paper receipts.. easy to use :-)
title: Fantastic

review: I just download the app and set it up! Quite easy  which is great! But there is no option to link the velocity card! Then I started reading the review and found out a lot of customers like me had same comments about it and most of comments are more than a year ago! Just wondering when will you be able to add the app. Because if It can’t be added then I don’t think I will use it as I rather get the points!
title: I want to link it to my velocity card!!!

review:
Why can’t I earn Velocity Points in the BPMe App? I know the trial version was rumoured to have offered this amongst also tracking odometer readings for tax purposes.

The last message I had from BP said there will be exciting new features early in 2018... it’s now 2019 and I don’t think it’s changed since I first used it in 2017.
No CarPlay, no odometer recording and no ability to atleast earn velocity points... I’m not even worried about redeeming them... earning would be a great start.
title: No new features...

review: The only thing i dont like about the app is the fact u cant , get ur velocity points
title: Velocity

review: Response a little slow
title: Slow response

review: App has worked perfectly for me and is an absolute lifesaver when the kids are asleep in the car. Even when they’re awake it makes life easier.
title: Superb for sleeping babies

review: Not a good start - simply refuses to add any payment methods. PayPal spins its wheels and dies, it refuses to add my visa debit, etc. Seems unpolished and clunky. More or less unusable.
title: Not a good app

review: Have used this App only 4 times, and 2 of them were a hassle. First time I paid for someone else’s fuel, but that was sorted quickly and locally. The last time the PayPay failed to verify payment, so I thought it would be easy to just pop inside and pay. When I went in they assured me payment HAD gone through I showed them the email, but they were happy it was settled. From then on I was bombarded with emails from BPme who demanded I give them my credit card details for payment. As I never give out my card details over the phone or internet I asked for an alternative payment method. Having to deal with their Customer ‘Care’ group is a nightmare and took way too much time to resolve. Avoid this App as it is CrApp and will not save you time or money. One star for the pretty colours.
title: NOT worth the angst

review:
Slow and only works half the time. 

Very inconvenient when you have your baby in the car. 

One time I filled up and then said payment declined. Go in and the clerk says it’s all paid. Very frustrating.
title: Works half the time

review: I’ve been overcharged twice by this app now, won’t be using it again!
title: Ripped off

review: When switching from over the counter payment to using the app, this customer benefit is currently lost. Please prioritize the ability to link Velocity Rewards account details to app payment account.
title: Please link Velocity Rewards

review: Works well for fuel not in enough stations and doesn’t work for LPG customers which is a shame
title: LPG no go

review: The app is convenient, it wasn’t so slow. Majority of use, I am sitting there waiting for the app to start while others are walking in paying for their fuel. When it finally does start, and I go through the steps to unlock the pump, finally filling up my car, I then have to sit there for what feels like eternity for the payment to process. I’ve tried deleting and reinstalling the app, and it still the same. I also tried to give feedback on the app, and even that doesn’t work and says “feedback submission failed”. Caltex app is way better!
title: Slow!

review: Love using the BP app, but find it frustrating that there are so few stations offering the service. Was shocked to pull into Calder Park BP (Vic) and find the service not available through that station.
title: More stations please

review: Think I’ll wait for my velocity to be linked before I use this app....it’s about the only reason I use BP....now I’m having problems posting this comment in the app, had to go to App Store to post this!!!....really?
title: 1st time user

review: “something gone wrong”  this is frustrating to log into 😡
title: Frustrating

review:
Used successfully for 6 months or so. Then stops working- payment refused. Checked with PayPal - they have never refused anything. Suspect changing PayPal password could be the issue. However the app has no facility to update a PayPal password. Was told on the phone to add a credit card- make that the default and then change back to PayPal - not only did that NOT work there seems to be no way to remove the card details. 
Have requested my account be deleted and ALL data relating to me be removed from the BP database.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4922499, 'body': "Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

We're sorry to hear you had this experience. We are looking into this further to understand what caused this. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience and we will pass this on to the developers.

If you have any further queries regarding BPme, please contact us as below.


Kind regards,

BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)", 'modified': '2018-09-04T00:22:36Z'}

review: Good if you are at the BP station - BUT - if your kids are on a trip and you want to pay for their fuel, you can’t - which also means if your husband, wife, friend or etc rings and says help I left my wallet at home, you can’t help them because the one major fault of this app is that your GPS location has to be at the BP garage that you want to pay at. Apart from that it is an ok app. Could be a great one if they fixed that problem.
title: GPS Blocks helping others

review: Downloaded the app but may as well delete it. The only reason I shop at BP is for Velocity points. No point using the app without them.
title: No velocity points

review: Great service but need to add velocity card option
title: Velocity

review: Account should link to flybuys or velocity points

review: This app never seems to work. All I get is a ‘something went wrong’ screen trying to log in. Terrible when you have two kids in the car trying to fill up. Please fix these issues prior to advertising you have this functionality!
title: Super glitchy

review:
I’ve now deleted this app.

The app invites you to register with your PayPal account. Great I thought, but the app or the backend systems are too flaky and unreliable.

God knows what effect the number of declined payments are going to have on my credit score.

Thanks BP, I’ll stick to paying in-store.
title: Flaky performance with PayPal

review:
Pathetic app 
It won’t let you claim velocity point 
You better off going inside to pay for fuel and claim  velocity point

Zero stars
title: No option for claiming velocity points

review: In the app you can add a credit card. When the card expires you can add the new valid credit card. But the app keeps selecting the expired card for payment.  This is a bug. The app should have an option to delete a credit card.
developerResponse: {'id': 9999519, 'body': "Hi 911-966, thanks so much for using BPme and sharing your feedback. Should you like to delete a payment method in your BPme wallet, just select the 'Account' Icon in the bottom right of your screen, then Select 'Payment Details' on the main screen that appears and swipe left on the payment type that you would like to remove. A 'Delete' option will appear, allowing you to remove the payment type from your wallet. Hope this helps! Best, BPme Support", 'modified': '2019-08-05T03:19:55Z'}
title: No option to delete a credit card

review:
It took me 5 minutes on this app before I can start pumping the fuel. 
Please make the process quicker.
title: Too slow

review: The app is slow, also missing feature for adding Virgin Velocity Frequent Flyers points.
title: Slow as snails

review:
Used it for the first time and everything looked good until I jumped back into my car and unlocked my phone to see "Unknown Error Occurred". 

Straight after this I got an emailed receipt so it must have gone through...the Police haven't paid me a visit anyway! ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Also can't use the highly advertised Velocity Points with it.
title: Worryingly not smooth

review: I am not happy with the false advertising this app has caused, the bp run was supposed to be a game you’d play and you’d win prizes I won a 20$ gift card and after 2 weeks it had finally came into the mail as I had no money on me I went to see if I could put petrol in with this gift card and when I got to the front desk it had no funds in it !! I only had just opened it and no one other then myself received or opened it I am not happy !!!! and I’m very disappointed in this 😡😡😡😡
developerResponse: {'id': 9717876, 'body': "Oh no, that doesn't sound great. Send us an email to aucustcare@bp.com with the details of your gift card and we will investigate. Thank you.", 'modified': '2019-07-18T03:53:03Z'}

review: The main reason I use BP fuel is to collect Velocity points. Without that, I have mixed feelings about using the app.
title: Handy but missing Velocity integration

review:
Fantastic app! 
I used to go to Caltex as being able to pay at the pump and not having to get my baby out of the car saved me a lot of hassle.
However, when I could, I much preferred to go to BP so I could get the Virgin Velocity points.
So this app solves one part of the equation for me, but I’m looking forward to when the app can be connected with to my Velocity membership so I can collect points.

review: Thankyou bp for allowing me to safely get petrol while my baby is sleeping in the car. This app means I don’t have to wake her to go in the store to pay!
