title: Thankyou

review: I feel like the three BP apps on the App Store could be rolled into one app, you should be able to: see fuel prices, filter stations by fuel type availability and link your velocity account. The app’s UI could look more iOS 12/13ey.
title: A bit lacking

review: This app is useless if you want to use your virgin rewards card for points as promoted by BP.   You still have to physically swipe your card in the store.  Firstly using a physical card is archaic with modern bar code systems and building an app that ignores partner arrangements excludes a portion of your customer base.
title: No Rewards, no point.

review: Support to add your Velocity card was promised some time back, still have not heard anything
title: Still no Velocity Support

review: Please add support for MotorPass
title: Can't use with MotorPass

review: Enjoying it
title: Excellent service

review: Great app. Very convenient when fueling. Still waiting for the ability to be able to earn Velocity points via the app though like you can do in store
title: Very convenient

review: For an app that promotes a faster way to fill up, the log in process is much too long. Each time I’m sitting at the bowser logging in with email and password and then the security question!!? Needs a pass code or even better, face/ Touch ID login and this app would be perfect.
title: Poor user experience

review: Just tried to set up. Asked for verification code, entered said verification code and app denied verification code. Went through this process with five different codes, none worked. App deleted.
title: Verification codes don’t work

review: By the time you pull up to the pump and load the app and go through the process to find your station, pump, authorize payment etc. it’s just as quick and easy to pay the conventional way. When you do what to make use of the app mainly at a BP super store on a Highway these stores are not included.
title: Pretty Disappointed

review: Tried numerous times to verify mobile number with code but keeps rejecting saying incorrect code, would love to use this app but can’t even get past the log in page
title: Verification code error

review: Takes a little to long to originally connect at this outlet
title: Wait Time

review: The app is alright. It’s a little slow but I mainly downloaded it to see the fuel prices. I’ll change the rating once it’s implemented
title: Not bad

review: Agonisingly slow to respond at almost every step of the process. Slow to start the app, slow to determine your location, slow to unlock the pump and slow to process the payment. I frequently see others fill up at the same time as me and beat me out of the station by paying the old fashioned way. I love the concept, but please speed it up!
title: Very slow

review: Very basic app without any features like rewards point, discount etc.
title: Reward program

review: So am I missing out on Velocity if I use this? I am more interested in those points than using this system. Thanks.
title: Is Velocity an issue still?

review: I was hesitant to get this app based on reading prior reviews, but thought I’d give it a go (due to a promotion from my Amex card). Downloaded app ok. Entered name and email details and it says will send me a confirmation email - it never arrived (and not in my junk mail folder). I try again and it says a registration already exists under my email account! Only option is to try a “password reset”. It generates an email that I DO receive this time. Update to a new password and log in to website successfully, but it says I “don’t have access to any apps”. Try logging in again via the app on the phone and it won’t work. No contact details provided to contact BP tech Dept. I’ve given up and will just use other service stations for my fuel purchases.
title: Terrible - what wast of time!

review: Tried for the first time when I was in BPme enabled station. It could pick up the right location but it loaded infinitely until time outs when selecting pump number. Tried many times but no luck. Ended up still paying at the counter.
title: Keeps loading until time outs when selecting pump number

review: Wouldn’t work at BP Albany Creek so I had to line up anyway, back to Caltex I go
title: Time Waster

review: Too slow
title: BP ME App

review: BPme App doesn’t work on iOS 13.0
title: BPme App doesn’t work on iOS 13.0

review: Lots of bugs with the app. I was stuck at the bowser as it wouldn’t unlock. Then once I completed filling up my car the app told me the bowser is now ready. I had to go to the cashier anyway.
title: Don’t download this app

review: I can’t add my Amex card to my account. I’ve tried two different cards and get the same error each time “there was a problem adding your card”. Because of this I missed out on the $10 Amex credit after I had to use PayPal.
title: Error adding my card - lost $10 credit

review: I love that I can fill up and the kids stay in the car. It’s easy and so much safer than having to take 5 kids in to the shop to pay! Thank you BP!
title: Kids and cars!

review: This app is the biggest disaster since BP Deepwater Horizon! Absolute punish to set up, far too many steps of verification to create an account, only to find that pre-authorisation is required BEFORE filling up! Note to the developers, might be worth checking out the FuelPay app from Caltex.
title: I’ll be filling up at Caltex next time!

review: This would be a handy tool if we could pay with our BP fuel card.
title: Can’t pay with BP fuel card..

review: What a pain in the neck to setup, gave up on the PayPal option couldn’t get it to login after doing it.
title: Painful to set up

review:
More a suggestion to improve the app.
If you could link your velocity frequent flyers partners account to this account so you still get points. That’s the only thing that would discourage me from using this app. Some people tap their velocity card but pay with a debit card. So you would miss out.
title: Like the idea of the app

review: Gave up on trying to login as I never received the verification email. Tried that many times but never received. Thanks BP for wasting my time that I will never get back
title: Rubbish app - Can’t login

review:
App asks for an unnecessary amount of personal information to verify me, email + phone number, the works. (doesn’t require anything beyond an email to confirm that it’s actually me) then once the app finally gets through gathering all my personal info it gets stuck in loading loops and can’t link me to any nearby stores (even though it clearly has my location I can see this on the apps internal gps) 

This app is complete garbage, don’t waste your time.
title: This app is trash

review:
PRO’s:
👍🏻 Rolling up to a servo and not having to walk inside & queue to pay.
👍🏻 Digital receipts for tax time

CON’s: 
👎🏻 App title doesn’t work with Siri “Hey Siri, open BPme” “I’m sorry you don’t have an app named BP me”... that space makes all the difference. Change the name and it would open...
👎🏻 Can’t pre-set an amount you want to refuel to. It would be ideal to set it to the same presets as a bowser.
👎🏻 Not all BP’s are on board.
title: Great but needs work

review: I love that I can fuel up and go and not needing to go inside especially when you have young children
title: Fantastic

review: Easy to use, although quite slow. It's perfect for when the baby is in the car and you don't want to lift them out to go in and pay. They need to hurry up and link velocity rewards, it's a big reason I even choose BP so no point without it.
title: Very handy but has pros and cons

review:
Can’t use the app to unlock pumps after midnight. I fail to understand the point of this app when you can’t use it when the petrol station is shut. Maybe you can save the minute you’d walk into pay but you’ll lose 15+ setting it up. Thumbs down from me 👎

Edit: actually, having thought more about it setting up the location you’re at and selecting your pump number would take just as much time as walking in to pay so no benefit at all
title: (Almost) Useless!

review: I gave up. There were just too many hurdles... email address, email verification code, password setup (paste prohibited!), password login, phone number, phone verification code, secret question and secret answer... ten minutes in and I hadn’t even reached billing info. This is all without even a peek at any potential functionality so no idea if it was going to be worth it. A great way to kill half an hour on a dull road trip, if you’re not driving.
title: Too hard to set up.

review:
I was overcharged while using the BPme app. 
Suggest Customers to double check the pump value and the app charge after use . Raised the issue with their Support 2 months ago and they still haven’t processed the refund or found the cause of the issue :(
title: Beware! I was Over charged on app

review:
Hi,

Would be awesome if you could switch on ability to choose location from anywhere, so I can pay for petrol for someone else... through my app, if they tell me which pump they are at.

I just tried to do this for my nanny (when I’m at work) and it would only let me search for petrol stations not let me select it, so I can pay from my phone (when not onsite).

This would be awesome, solving a real customer problem.  Thanks!!
developerResponse: {'id': 11965842, 'body': "Hi Katherine, thanks so much for your feedback. We're very happy to hear that you are enjoying BPme. We've shared your feedback with the BP Development team! 👍 ", 'modified': '2019-11-21T05:32:40Z'}
title: Great... BUT I have an idea for you BP App owners

review:
First time using 
I was broke had twenty dollars left to my name and filled up with twenty dollars fuel. The app takes out 1 dollar leaving me with not enough money to pay. Thanks for your kick in the teeth
title: Embarrassing

review: Have failed to use the app a few times now, and found out every time I request to use a pump and if it fails it takes a dollar off my bank account and never return it back. System flaw or just a bad app or a dollar by dollar generator. Go figure
title: Highly not recommended

review: The whole point of this is to not go in store BUT you can’t add your velocity card and that is ridiculous
title: Velocity Card

review:
Just a quick question, why can’t we add our Velocity Frequent Flyer card with our account so we get the benefits without having to get out of the car? This is not a real question, I don’t need to know why I just want to be able to do it and I will change my rating for the app, otherwise the app is pointless for me. Great idea, just need to follow through with your rewards. 
Thank you.
I was told a year ago watch this space... I’ve stopped watching nothing is happening and have other things to do...
developerResponse: {'id': 3319741, 'body': 'Hi there, we have introduced the fuel payment function to help customers save time. BPme is transformational and we are planning a whole range of exciting new offers to make our customers lives easier. You can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Watch this space for new BPme features in the future.', 'modified': '2018-05-02T00:46:52Z'}
title: Virgin Velocity Frequent Flyer

review: Attempting to set up this app, to make fill-ups easier with a bub in the car. Set up is *ridiculously* long. I’ve not bothered completing registration.
title: Too loooooong

review: This app is terrible and every time I try to use it the app never works!
developerResponse: {'id': 12368256, 'body': 'Thanks for your feedback PaulParsons1981. We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review and are always looking for ways to improve the app. If you have the time, please email us a aucustcare@bp.com with details of the issue you are having, we would like to investigate further and improve your experience where we can. ', 'modified': '2019-12-12T23:29:47Z'}
title: Never works and sooooo slow

review:
I downloaded the app so I wouldn’t have to get the baby out of the car to go inside to pay.  Admittedly it does take some time before you can start to pump your fuel but if you have a sleeping baby in the car, it’s so worth it.

My only query would be why the station is allowed to exclude pumps from the app choice. Eg At my local BP I cannot choose pump 3 which is the cheapest fuel, I have to choose one of the other pumps with the more expensive fuel.

Something I think would be great would be if you could use the app to pay for fuel even if you aren’t at the service station, in an emergency for a family member for example.  Also it would be nice if you could see that you can’t use the app before pulling up to the pump, sometimes I’ve bypassed a less expensive choice only to get to the BP and not be able to use the app

All in all I love it, my local is quite slow at activating the pump and processing the payment but it still beats unbuckling a sleeping baby!  I want all the other brands to get an app like this so when I can’t find a BP I can still pay from my car.

developerResponse:
{'id': 6170389, 'body': 'Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP.  

BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure); this also occurs when you load your card into the app. This will be released by your financial provider. Your financial provider will be able to give you more information on how long it will take to be released, but generally for financial cards like VISA, AMEX and MasterCard, the pre authorisation hold will be released from the account within 3-10 business days. With all PayPal transactions, your account will show the $1 pre authorisation hold for 29 days and will feature as a pending payment in your account.

We suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions.

Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)', 'modified': '2018-11-30T00:26:21Z'}

Without my account properly set up, I also can’t set up a PIN for the app, meaning my bank details are unsecured. 

I suspect Kermit the frog would do a better job protecting my information...

title: Doesnt work anymore

review:
So I wanted to use this APP in order to save time to avoid manual payment and avoid kids from getting out of the car to cashier. End up spending 20 mins + sorting out the issue this APP caused. 

It works perfectly fine if the pump can only be accessed from one side, so when your car is parked your pump is yours to use. But when the pump can be accessed from either side here comes the problem. I have just unlocked the pump in the car and about to fill up, the pump was lifted up by another customer from the opposite side.

I went to the cashier and ask to cancel the BP me Payment straight away, but they can’t even see the transaction on the screen. There is no cancel option on the APP once it s unlocked and pump is lifted up. I ended up paying for somebody else who don’t have cash to pay me back and don’t have card to withdraw cash. What made it worst the cashier can’t treat it as cash out either. End up the person was understanding and nice and agreed to pay me through bank transfer. However the hassle it caused for both of us, I would never use this app again until this bug gets fixed. Not to mention I was now late for my appointment for 25 mins.

Since there is no feedback option in BP station, I am sharing my not so pleasant experience here.

title: No luck finding a fuel station that it works with

review: App setup was easy.  But so far, the app has not been helpful to me- it didn’t find and give any info on the 7 common stations I use, and the 2 it could find can’t or won’t process payment by the app.   I think a 10+ character password is ridiculous, why not a 4+?  Main concern is the “Store Finder” function in the app does not show any of the 7 BP stations in my region (west Gippsland, VIC) or the one in my parents’ area that I use. (3029, VIC).  That was without any search filters applied too.  I initially had filters to look for BPme-enabled stations & BP Rewards stations but my stations of interest did not appear on map.  I removed the filters and they still did not display.  App REQUIRES device’s ‘Location Services’ to be ON in order to complete registration which I do not like- I would prefer to be able to register without Location Services, and then just manually enter a town name, or only activate Location Services manually for search if I was looking for a servo in an unfamiliar region where I didn’t know town name/s to enter.  I would prefer the Store Finder map to display ALL stations and just be able to zoom in to the area I was in, rather than having to enter town names or activate Location Services.  Also, I was extremely disappointed and surprised that two major stations on M1 Freeway (Officer, VIC) are not currently BPme-enabled!  It should be a business requirement than any station on an A-road (fwy/hwy) *must* have BPme facility.
developerResponse: {'id': 14474204, 'body': "Hi there, Really appreciate the time you've taken in providing your feedback.  We are so sorry for the inconvenience you've had using the location search.  Your query does help us improve our app and will pass on your feedback to our dev team.   Otherwise, I can suggest clearing cache and re installing the app.  If the issue still persists, please feel free to contact aucustcare@bp.com with your contact details, we would be happy to assist you. review: Am I to use a BP Card or BPme Card. I use BP normally but just trying to work out how I now gain QANTAS points rewards since BP and Virgin Airline have parted ways in Australia?
developerResponse: {'id': 14504962, 'body': 'Hi there. BP Rewards lets you choose between earning BP Points or Qantas Points. After you register for BP Rewards on either bprewards.com.au or the BPme app, choose between earning BP Points or Qantas Points on the website.In order to earn Qantas Points, you’ll need to be an existing Qantas Frequent Flyer member and have linked your Qantas Frequent Flyer membership number to your BP Rewards account when you decide to choose earning BP Points. You can only link one Qantas Frequent Flyer membership number.', 'modified': '2020-04-07T04:29:02Z'}
title: Confused ...

review:
Hi, 

Initially I had an issue register into this BPme app, most annoying part is the password, I doubt even my Gmail has such a complicated password & appreciate a minimum of 4digit password or Maximum of 10 digit password requirement with 1Capital & Numbers would be more than safe enough, Then the most annoying thing is that each time when we login it asks for a Verification code which we have to open up Emails over & over which is ridiculous even after saving the password you still need a verification... It’s not a banking system to be this much secured I guess... Once we used the velocity point scheme it was just easy & it’s just the matter of tapping the card... Well I gave 1 star leaving some room for the developers to improve & hope you’ll will continue to do good for the customers, on top of that wonder whether apple wallet option is added? 🤞
developerResponse: {'id': 14504941, 'body': "Hi there, thanks so much for your feedback. We will most certainly feed your login experience back to the BPme Technical Support team. BP Rewards in BPme is a new feature that allows you to earn either BP Points or Qantas Frequent Flyer Points every time you Pay for Fuel with BPme, or shop in store. If you'd like more information about the program, visit bprewards.com.au - you can use your BPme login to access the website and learn more. Thanks for your support!", 'modified': '2020-04-07T04:27:33Z'}
title: Login Verification

review: I set up the app and registered my details. When I log on, it is supposed to send a verification email, but it doesn’t. So, can’t use it, and I have no way of fixing this. Tried it with both my iPad and iPhone. Same issue with both. I give up.
developerResponse: {'id': 14505011, 'body': "Oops! It may have gone to your spam folder. If you still can't find the email, head to the login page of bprewards.com.au and click ‘reset password’ and a new email with instructions will be sent. title: Overcharging

review:
I’ve had this app twice now, by using 2 different email addresses. I’ve had to re-download the app and re-register with a different email address because it simply stopped working out of the blue one day. 

I sent an email to support but I was asked to send in so many technical answers, it was easier just to begin the whole process again.

Second time around, same thing has happened.
The idea is awesome, it’s so convenient not having to walk in to pay for fuel, but again, randomly, the app is “experiencing technical issues”. That’s all I get, no automatic email from BP explaining why my app won’t work or giving me a workaround, I’m expected to find a solution on my own or email support and answer questions that no one has time for.

I’ve also often found myself waiting in my car, in the forecourt of BP for over 10 minutes whilst the clerk processes my payment inside, even though I can see the station is empty. Maybe when a customer is not standing in front of you, the sense of urgency is lessened, but that’s not the developer’s issue, although it certainly makes the app less convenient.
developerResponse: {'id': 15741791, 'body': 'Hi Anna, we apologise for the inconvenience caused. Please know we have shared your feedback with our technical team to resolve ASAP. Thanks for letting us know', 'modified': '2020-06-03T06:14:24Z'}

review:
Too many verification steps when setting up the account which is slightly annoying. Once the password is setup, you are again asked to verify the code via your email. 
App is slow in loading menus after a button is pressed. Apart from these two factors the functions are quite convenient. :)

Pleased to hear that you are finding the app convenient 😊', 'modified': '2020-06-08T01:11:43Z'}
title: Too many verification steps

review:

After writing this review I received a swift reply from the developer on how to find a BP which uses the app. I’ve upgraded my rating due to the prompt and useful reply from the developer, very proactive. (Looking forward to actually using it!!)
 Makes me think the developer is looking for constructive  feedback and trying to improve user experience.

title: Not able to use, stuck in “Account updates” window

review:
Service station opening hours are not shown, which is the single most fundamental piece of information I would expect to see in this type of app.

Even more frustratingly than saying nothing at all, the app teases “Closing Soon” for some service stations - indicating that data on opening hours is buried somewhere in the system, but just kept secret from potential customers for some unimaginable reason.  “Closing Soon” does not help when you’re trying to figure out whether to drive to a service station or not! Will it be closed in an hour? In 5 minutes? This app doesn’t tell you.

Other information is also out of date / inconsistent. App shows a BP station being “Open now” near my house, despite that service station having been demolished for redevelopment several months ago. Admittedly there is a note within the “Location” (street address) for that service station which says it is “temporarily closed” but this just adds to the confusion; on a single screen, I can see that particular service station being noted as “Open now” AND “temporarily closed” AND “24 hours”?! Which one is it? Makes you question whether you can rely on this app at all on a long drive.
developerResponse: {'id': 16268707, 'body': 'Hi Eugene, thanks for your feedback.  We are sorry for the confusion, we had a technical issue with the app showing some BP sites being decommissioned which is incorrect.  This issue has now been rectified. ', 'modified': '2020-06-29T00:35:54Z'}

The app crashed twice through the process and gave me several “sorry something went wrong type messages”.  I’m finally in but now it won’t let me register the card I was given in store because it keeps crashing! The app is terribly slow too. So disappointing. Sorry guys but it’s not been good.

title: Bugs bugs bugs

review:
Time saver and easy WHEN IT WORKS.
When it DOESN’T:

wait forever in full 4GX service for the app to connect.

wait for it to determine your location

wait again for it to re-connect to PayPal because it has lost the association to your account.

Finally it connects and you log into PayPal and set it up again.

WAIT more while it tries to connect to the pump
It tells you to hang on (real helpful).

Eventually the pump unlocks, you get your fuel and it tells you to go inside because there’s been a problem with the transaction 😩

So after 10 mins parked to get 40 L of fuel you look like an idiot thanks to the quick and easy app..

Buuuut as you’re walking inside you see PP on your phone notify you you’ve been charged.

SORT YOUR S—T out BP.

title: Was ok, now not so good.

review:
I filled up with petrol to try out the “Pay for Fuel” app and receive Qantas points offer. It was not a smooth process so I went inside and received advice on how to make the app work. I could fit in just $1 more so tried again but this time was told I should have waited longer before putting in petrol.  I gave up on BP and my Qantas points - a hopeless app so I’ll go back to Woolworths petrol in future.

When entering card details on app, I was advised that $1 would be temporarily charged to authenticate card, but BP has taken $1 four times and won’t let me remove card details from app.  How much more money do they plan to steal?  STAY AWAY FROM THIS APP.
title: Extremely disappointed

review: Useless app. BP offers 250 Qantas points for first time use, so the app guided me to the closest BP service station. Was more expensive than other brands but gave it a go. After fueling the app said there was a technical problem and should ask inside. Went inside where the cashier told me, that like many other BP in the app they were privately owned so no use of the app and no Qantas points. Thanks to the app I wasted 6 dollar and no points. Why does the app guide me to a non participating BP service station without warning ?

Takes way to long to load the app and at times it doesn’t load at all so you cannot get your points.

Bonus points even when activated rarely get awarded - this is false advertising!!! Should I talk to ACC? 
I’m done with BP, going to Shell where 100% of the times I get my rewards and their fuel is cheaper too.

title: Fuel Payment doesn’t work

review:
I’ve given review for old app before and they still haven’t fixed it

Unless u want to permanently have tracking and gps on give this a miss as it mandates compulsory location  tracking

Secondly the whole process is so stupid it doesnt tell the process

U have to actually use the app and tel your pump you are going to use it first before u start pumping fuel 

Ie This is not a payment app in the normal sense. If you fill up then try to pay using the app all it will do is reset the pump for the next fillup. Not obvious at all and the app is no help - no prompt

Given this poorly designed app a wide berth

title: Worst app ever

review: The interface is incredibly clunky and slow. Wait while app opens. Wait while app finds location. Choose location. Wait while pump numbers load. Chose pump. Wait while payment method loads. Choose payment method. Wait for console operator to unlock pump. Fill up. Wait for payment to process. Fill out app feedback. Give one star and complain it’s slow and clunky. Wait while feedback loads. Nothing changes and hasn’t for over a year. Can’t give zero stars so one will have to do.

title: When it works it’s great

review: Was absolutely loving this app. Super easy to pay for fuel and able to earn Qantas Points and regular points bonus too. Heaps safer as less contact with people because of Covid-19.  But since mid August I haven’t been able to use the app at my local BP store as it always comes up with when trying to select your pump number “Sorry, we’re having some technical issues. Please start again or fill up and pay for your fuel in the shop” Start again. I’ve tried everything thing from going into the shop to see if there is an issue at there end. I’ve made sure the app it’s updated to the most recent update. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled. I’ve logged out then logged back in. It’s very frustrating as I’ve missed out on bonus Qantas points I could of earnt because of this app now working how it should 😫

review:
I have used this driving from North NSW on the QLD border through to Sydney with great success. 
I have had a couple of problems where the pump would not unlock, this was a local issue.
My only wish is for petrol prices to be shown per station. I use U98, the price per L variance is commonly around 24-29 cents in my area, a massive difference when filling up. I have to use the Fuel check NSW App to find the best price.

title: Rubbish

review:
I don’t see why there needs to be the BP plus app and the BP ME app. On one hand you’re promoting the BP Plus app for not having to go in store, but then you’re sending me emails to say use you’re BP me app or scan you’re card to earn extra points. 

Simple option to fix this for you. Allow us BP PLUS customers to add our cards as a payment method, that way we can take advantage of the promotions with your BP me app while still having the convenience and perks of the business card. 

Please stop dangling carrots if your just gunnu give us the stick. Cheers

review:
Handy app for collecting points and buying fuel but wen trying to order food/drinks it is very limited to what you can get.
Hopefully it will expand as for daily users such as myself it would be nice to pre-order what I get as it would save me 10 minutes of my driving time to work.

title: Handy

review: When you are at the counter or opening to pay for fuel it takes ages to open the app, especially if there is a line in the store, I have a new iPhone and full bars of service and still slow , need to work on the speed of opening. Also when buying fuel operators need more training to accept as often I have had to walk into store and hold up phone to get them to activate it for fuel purchasing - still a good app but has bugs still to make it quicker to use.

title: User update T&C not responding

review:
Needs a total rewrite and probably a change to the whole architecture. Then needs some real world testing to get the bugs and workflow sorted. 

Latest in this fiasco is the endless loop when agreeing to revised terms and condition. Unusable. 

Design is confusing. Do I fill then start the app?  Do I select payment type then fill?  Do I fill then select the pump?  None of the above, but who knew?

2 factor auth by an email that takes many minutes to arrive while sitting with a queue of customers is unacceptable. Unusable. 

Sorry devs, quit and give this to a competent team.

title: Super glitchy

review:
This is the second time I’ve attempted to use this app at the bowser. When I opened  the version I had I was informed I needed to update. I did. I attempt to login. I am I formed I need to update again. I attempt to. And so begins an endless loop of ‘update required’ and being told I have updated the version when I’m in the App Store.. also why oh why do I need multiple emails/ notifications to update my password? Which then sends me on a loop of update password, which I select only to be prompted each time I click on the link in the password update email to get a verification code.. and end up back at the ‘send email to update password’ screen/ option. 

Seriously unimpressed.

title: Not working

review: I first submitted a request for support in Sept 2020. The app had been working fine but then just froze on me. I uninstalled and installed multiple times, restarted, no luck. I have an iPhone 11 and am using the 4.20.0 version of the app. It’s 22 Dec 2020 and after multiple emails back and forth from customer service, I still can’t use the app. They’ve asked the same questions many times, and on the 13 Nov promised a “speedy resolution” and then I heard nothing for over a month until I called and started a new customer service request. Legitimately the worst customer support I’ve ever dealt with. Disappointing that such a big branch cannot invest the resources into getting this app right.

title: Great in principle, poor in practice

review: My biggest gripe with this app is around the load time.  My primary use (ie every week) is to simply scan my card when buying fuel - I rarely ever search for service stations and don’t have the option to use the payment functionality because it isn’t supported widely enough yet.  Opening the app take *far* too long and I then need to tap the card to get the barcode, while everyone behind me silently fumes.  *Integration with apple wallet would solve all that. * Too many times I’ve just given up and paid without scanning because it’s so slow.  Also many stations are listed as having 95 and don’t actually have it.

title: Unreliable and buggy

review: It worked really well when it was first released minus the option to add rewards. However app will not work when you are not on the latest release/update. Now, after adding rewards options and makes it look pretty the app is super slow! Took ages to unlock actual pump and took another 2-5 min confirmation that payment gone through!
title: Good idea bad execution!

review:
Incredibly frustrating app. Logs out of the account without warning so you try to use it either after you’ve paid if going inside or at the pump is trying to remotely and you can’t because you are then forced to go through a security log in process like It’s asking for the nuclear launch codes. 

Doesn’t show my transaction purchase history despite scanning it when it does decide to work 

Logged my wife out and she had to sit for 15 minutes on a 40 degree day trying to make it work. Tried to log in via PayPal option but it then said was already a username to use that instead despite It showing as a different option when the account password didn’t work. Sends the verification to the email not the phone resulting in more drawn out verification to which point the phone overheated and couldn’t be used anyway 

I compare this to the absolute ease of the 7/11 app and I happily use with much greater ease.
title: Logs out and slow

review:
Each time I launch the app the iOS bannner comes up saying that it has copied the contents of my clipboard - there is no good reason to snoop on my clipboard this is either sloppy or dodgy programming. 

Also the store locator doesn’t clearly show stores participating in the rewards program unless you apply a filter which caused me to lose lots of points when I first joined as I filled up at a non-participating store. 

App should also show points activity - Woolworths Rewards App is a good example of doing this well.
title: Snoops on the clipboard - doesn’t clearly show participating stores

review: It doesn’t work - takes up to five minutes to load and by that time you could have gone  in and paid 5 times over. Sometimes it takes ten minutes. Useless.
title: Waste of time

review:
Please fix this app, not working 4/2/21 
It saves time going into the store and waiting long periods,
title: Fix this app

review: Buggy and slow app. Spent several minutes trying to create an account and can’t login. Horrible experience.
title: Can’t even create an account

review:
I tried to make an account on pc first. It didn’t send the verification email needed to set a password. When I tried to remake an account using the rewards card, it said the account was already in use, but a week later, I still don’t have the email to set a password, and resending the password does nothing. If I messed up my email, which is possible, *there is no way for me to use the rewards card*.

So I tried to use the mobile app. 2 text message codes and *3* email codes later, and it tells me the app is experiencing difficulties and that the process has failed, probably because my location services are off. I shouldn’t need to have my location services on to make an account. I shouldn’t need a 10 digit password for a fuel app account. I shouldn’t need 3 forms of verification for a fuel app account. 

I’m just going to trash the rewards card and delete the app.
title: Making an account is like pulling teeth

review: The bid app in the world
title: Hi there

review: I just wan to register a new account, first couldn’t set my password properly and have to use forget password to set the password, after set the née password it takes ages to login main page, now I am stuck this verify septs for over 15mins still haven’t right Wally login this app......
title: UI and UX super unfriendly

review:
App process to unlock the pump can be slow and frequently fails, requires a re-try. Assume it’s taking it’s time checking my credit card and processing $1. You already have my verified details, so why the $1 check every time???

And it never seems to work at all at one of my locals that’s supposed to be BPme equiped. Staff always say it’s a temporary outage- but that’s been the story for two months. 

But when it works, it’s great. Just make it so always!
title: It’s OK, when it’s working

review: I try to log in and the app just freezes and can’t do anything - not great

Really disgusting for the service: for them are really easy to ripoff customers and hide them self when they make mistakes.
Why not go back to the footage and watch what really happened because I have the receipt to show that I haven’t used any points out from my reward card!!!

No way to collect points now 😡 tried emailing BP support about fixing the app or adding the barcode/member ship the website and just got no reply back. Please update and fix this app!!! Will gladly give it 5 stars then.

Pressing update later takes me to the App Store which only has Open, not Update as an option. I click Open which goes back to the App which says I need to update? Current version is unusable.
title: Unusable due to update prompt

review:
I've tried a few times to use the app after filling up at BP and am yet to successfully pay for fuel. Before I drove to BP I made sure I had a profile and was signed in (other reviews mention the subpar 
 sign up experience). I filled up, went to select my pump number and the discovered I couldn't select Apple Pay as a payment method like I could with Caltex. I had to scan in my credit card details or sign into PayPal. So I scanned my card details in, only to then find I was supposed to select the pump number in the app before filling up.

In the end I just went inside to pay over the counter and the attendant explained what you're meant to do. I found it completely counter-intuitive and much preferred the Caltex app user experience.

The app design is nice enough but I don't really care about extra tabs for rewards etc - just let me bang in a pump number, pay with apple pay like I do everything else and be on my way.
title: Think I'll switch back to Caltex

Underperforming application and needs more r&d and UAT, rather than pushing it live to appease shareholders

review:
This app charges $1 excess every time when you try to pay for fuel. It happened for the last three times for me.
Better not pay for fuel by app.
Customer support won’t respond to your email.
title: Poor service

review: Wanting to update the payment method but all I can do is delete the card and add it again. Why have email promo’s to use the app when the app is defunct.
developerResponse:
{'id': 23273282, 'body': "Hi iolhk,

We're sorry to hear about your experience and thank you for bringing this to our attention.

We appreciate your frustrations, and apologise for the inconvenience this has caused. This bug has been passed onto our team for further investigation.

If you would like to keep in touch, could you please send any further details to our consumer relations team at aucustcare@bp.com.

Thanks again for your feedback, we really appreciate it.", 'modified': '2021-06-08T22:31:17Z'}
title: Can’t update payment method

review: On two separate occasions now the app has either failed or required updating at the time of fuel purchase. And of course, the Apple App Store wasn’t available when critically needed. Store staff don’t have a clue and cannot offer a solution to preserve my fuel credits so it’s just another shrug and walk away. BP fuel was 2.5 cents dearer than competition today too, which just increases the hurt. Time to buy elsewhere. It’s a FAIL from me.
title: App failure and updates cause loss of points

review:
Please add Home Screen widgets for us to scan the barcode faster then opening the main app. Also thanks for adding my local BP ( Mortdale Nsw ) for pick-ups directly within BP app. It’s fantastic to use.

Edit review: pre-order for my coffee is amazing and easy. Thank you BP!!
developerResponse: {'id': 22836053, 'body': "Hi F2008, thank you for your feedback, we'll pass it on. Happy to hear you're enjoying the service :)", 'modified': '2021-05-17T02:32:36Z'}
title: Add a widget for us to scan how barcode!!

review: The app can’t identify the petrol station location even I am standing inside the shop. Thus I can’t use the BPme pay to pay for fuel. Useless.
title: Can’t use BP pay

Such a useless app.

review: My bank flagged this app as not secure and canceled my card that I had set up in the app
developerResponse:
{'id': 23190877, 'body': "Hi JEBFM, 

We are sorry to hear about your experience and can confirm that bp will never see nor store the details of your nominated cards. Such details are collected, stored and processed by bp's payment service providers, Braintree and PayPal, who process your purchases when you use the BPme app. For further information regarding Braintree and PayPal and how they encrypt and process payment transactions, see the Braintree and PayPal websites. You may find it helpful to have another conversation with your bank regarding your card. 

To learn more about BPme, please read the FAQs: https://www.bp.com/en_au/australia/home/products-services/bpme/faqs.html 
 
If you would like to keep in touch, could you please send any further details to our consumer relations team at aucustcare@bp.com. 

Thanks again for your feedback JEBFM, we really appreciate it.", 'modified': '2021-06-04T07:50:34Z'}
title: Not secure

review:
Your past reviews are just a bait when your current version hasn’t worked for the past 10 updates.

Moved onto Caltex, quick efficient and easy. It’s a shame I had $30 of rewards saved but whatever you lost a weekly customer.

Ans for the record I have both an iPhone X and iPhone 12 Pro on older and newest firmwares, get better developers.
title: Uninstalled, time to move on

review: I agree with others Caltex app is far better, it’s faster, allows you to pay after filling up and with Apple pay! PayPal option only uses your default payment method, you can’t select  business card for example unless it’s your default.That tells you all that is wrong with bpme. Go fix it! This is a very pathetic app in design. BP should think about the user experience and not offload design to incompetent imbeciles.
